Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and elegant next to Louve.”
Reviews.Author: Pdxevenstar
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here using my Hyatt points. It was SO wonderful. As soon as you enter the hotel, you feel the elegance, peacefulness and attention to detail. The hotel has a signature scent which I still remember. The rooms were very romantic, peaceful and nice statues throughout. Location was great, coffee shops, the Louve, and park nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,best choice in town”
Reviews.Author: alvesjr
Reviews.Content: modern,great service from concierge ( monsieur dominique and team ) , large rooms with great amenities , very good breakfast and restaurant for lunch.located at vendome in the best part of town.i return in this hotel 5 times wit my kids or only with my wife and all times great

Reviews.Title: “A PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: bestmilano
Reviews.Content: Definitely a five star hotel, ideally located in central Paris, suitable for demanding customers, but also for business trips. Front courtyard with bright, modern design linear and essential clean, spacious rooms with high ceilings, the travertine bathrooms with gold taps, large rain shower and separate tub. View of the courtyard or on the main road. The restaurants offer French cuisine Mediterranean. The very small but lovely spa. Note particularly significant impact on the handles and chandeliers wall of the rooms, are true sculptures. The only drawback of stay negative, constant smell of food in the lobby, elevator and especially in the rooms through a malfunctioning air conditioning system.

Reviews.Title: “5+ Star Hotel in Paris with Modern Interior”
Reviews.Author: Trendies
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt is a fantastic luxury hotel for people who don't want the Louis XV interior of other luxury hotels. Service is excellent, rooms are very large, and bathrooms are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, contemporary luxury and incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: swisstraveler63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this favourably located hotel for a weekend in Paris. As seasoned Paris travellers we always had wanted to stay near to one of our most favoured squares of Paris, the Place Vendôme. The Park Hyatt Paris is really an exquisitely designed and tastefully decorated place! We had already known the hotel from an earlier visit to the bar, but we were once again impressed by the sheer elegance of the site. We had booked a special offer, namely “Romance at the park” including breakfast and a fine bottle of Champagne, which was in our opinion reasonably priced. We had a Park Deluxe Twin Room going to the courtyard and were very satisfied with our choice. The room is spacious and well-appointed and the bathroom even more so. We twice had breakfast at Les Orchidées and indulged in the extraordinarily delicious dishes; we travel a lot and stay often at upscale places but rarely did we enjoy a breakfast that much! And the best was the staff, not only at Les Orchidées but all over the hotel. Everyone was very friendly, warm and professional. In my view, they couldn’t do any better. As I noticed when I was scanning other reviews this has to do with the policy that Hyatt pursues with its personnel. I honestly admire such an achievement because I haven’t encountered such a perfect performance at any other hotel yet. But enough praise now, there is also one negative point to mention and this concerns the prices. Whilst the rooms are adequately priced, this can’t be said of all the other things. We didn’t go to the hotel’s prime restaurant le Pur because we considered it as much too expensive. The same applies to the bar but we went there because we like the ambiance and the drinks are really superb. We didn’t use the spa and the fitness centre so we cannot comment on them but I’m sure we wouldn’t have been disappointed. On balance, we experienced such a high level of hospitality at Park Hyatt Paris that we had thought was not possible to achieve, my congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CardinalRK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend here in May. We had stayed at multiple European hotels and been sorely disappointed so we decided to splurge at the Park Hyatt. The stay was amazing. The staff all spoke impeccable English and were courteous and professional. The location was terrific for walking. The hotel room was terrific and for me the AC worked better than most European high end hotels I've stayed in. I'm a Diamond Member so breakfast was included. The breakfast was truly exceptional. This is one of my 3 favorite hotels that we've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Romantic, Elegant.”
Reviews.Author: fleurdsoleil
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Park Hyatt and this one did not disappoint. Location = easy to walk to things like the Palace Vendome and all the shops on the Rue de la Paix, but we also able to walk to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, and even the Champs Elysees. Service = Staff is friendly, and helpful if you have questions about where to eat and how to visit all the great sites of Paris. Food = We had breakfast every morning at the hotel and it was divine.You can taste the freshness in the fruit, the wonderful bread, and even by the herbs they use in the omelets. We did not try dinner in any of their restaurants, but hope to do so next time I'm back! Ambiance / Decor = This is exactly the type of style I love in a hotel. Contemporary, yet somehow timelessly elegant. I took pictures so I could try to find some of the great pieces I saw! But my absolute favorite part of Park Hyatt Vendome was how romantic it was. The lighting throughout the hotel as the evening set in, the rooms with sheer panels over the windows for a soft glow in the morning, it was fantastic. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Paris elegance”
Reviews.Author: gizmolisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early February for 4 nights. We have long been fans of Park Hyatt properties, and this one did not disappoint. Shortly after making our reservation, we received an email inviting us to upgrade to a Park Suite King for 80 extra Euros per night. We decided to live a little, and wow, what a room! The closet alone was the size of some rooms I've seen in Europe. This was the type of suite that is really one very large room, but it was VERY large, in fact the largest I've stayed in in Europe. It also has an extra 1/2 bath, which is a nice convenience. Beautiful finishes throughout the room and hotel and excellent service on all fronts. The ONLY negative was that the eating anything in the hotel was absurdly expensive. American breakfast for 48 Euros? Cocktails at 25 Euros? Really?? Even in a hotel of this caliber and price point, those prices are a stretch. Otherwise a great stay, though, and we will definitely return. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but wont be back”
Reviews.Author: ahmadsameh
Reviews.Content: Well, it is in a very good location in Paris and you expect it to be expensive but the standard of the room was in no way worth the rate charged. Park Hyatt is my favorite brand and i am beginning to discover that there are wild differences in the standards and the service, this is definitely the worst Park Hyatt i have stayed at. The pros: Good Location, clean and modern hotel with comfortable bed and nice bathroom even though the standard queen room is tiny by Park Hyatt standards. Breakfast was nice and staff were polite enough although very fake and snotty in the old Parisian way which tends to lose it charm after a while. Check in was smooth and very efficient. The cons: The room was old, worn out and in desperate need of renovation, the carpets were worn out and dirty and in need of a serious change (not Park Hyatt standard at all) There were almost no power outlets in the room and none near the working area which seems a bit weird for anyone wishing to work. The internet service was a DISASTER and kept dying on me ALL the time, it seems that this is a long running issue at this hotel, luckily as a Platinum member i did not have to pay for it otherwise it was 19 euros a day which is a rip off, everything else at the hotel is outrageously priced, i had to pay 130 euros for breakfast for two??? It also seems that unless you are a Gulf Sheik or a Russian or Chinese oligarch, then you are treated by the staff more as part of the decor than anything else, they simply have NO time for you, i was constantly stopped on the way in or out and asked if i had a reservation (and this is to sit in the lobby for Gods sake!) . All the common areas (restaurants and bars also) attract affluent Parisian clients that simply take over the place for breakfast, lunch and dinner during the week particularly and the hotel clients are totally marginalized because of this. I had to argue with one lady only because a colleague and i wished to sit in the lobby for a short business meeting and there were no places to sit, since all the table were set up for lunch for the external clients. This is really a serious issue that management needs to reconsider since the usual practice is for the hotel guests to have priority and not the other way around. The moral of the story is that for $800 a night (not including anything) you can find much better in Paris, i will definitely NEVER go back to this hotel, and very luckily a new Mandarin Oriental has just opened close by. BYE BYE Park Hyatt Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: kt127
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here, and it was very nice. First, the location is just excellent. About two blocks form the Palais Garnier - Opera, which is convenient for using the Air France bus to and from CDG (cost 10 Euros). Lots of luxury jewelry stores and other shops along Rue de la Paix, incuding the Ritz hotel. I went for a late night stroll both nights (weather in late February was surprisingly nice, a little brisk but not cold). The Place de la Concorde is a few blocks south west, and I got to see the Eiffel Tower twinkling through a slight layer of fog. Back to the hotel - I am a Diamond member with Hyatt, and I was upgraded from a junior suite to an executive suite, which was really nice - basically two adjoining rooms, with a living room area on one side and a bedroom area on the other side. And two full bathrooms. Also, received a nice bottle of Bordeaux and a small box of 4 chocolates;aas a welcome amenity. Internet was free for Diamons members, but is 19 euros per day otherwise. Had breakfast both mornings. Had the American breakfast / buffet in Les Orchidess one morning and had breakfast in my room on the second morning. Breakfast was complimentary as Diamond, but otherwise is 48 euros. The room was a little too warm for me, and even with the heat turned off, I slept with the windows open both nights. My room opened to a couryard below, so no street noise at all. The bathrooms are really nice - all marble, with a decent sized tub and a separate shower area. Actually the shower and a vanity is behind a glass door and both are adjacent to the tub - basically a wet area. Very nice thick towels and nice size bottles of shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel. Towel warmer was a nice touch. Robes, slippers provided. Also an umbrella was available, but fortunately I didn't need it during my stay. Mini bar has a nice variety of drinks and a small number of food items, and is very expensive - 12 euros for a coke or a beer (33 cL), 6 euros for a small can of pringles or a regular size container of TicTacs, 12 euros for a small container of nuts or candies. There is a lot of staff at this hotel, and all are very friendly and professional. Everyone speaks perfect English and even understands my high school level French! Had dinner at the restaurant Pur on my second night. Had the 5 course menu with wine. Delicious food and great service. Communicated with the concierge prior to arrival to secure reservations at Pur as well as other reservations elsewhere in the city. All requests were handled promptly and efficiently, and with a friendly sense of humor. All in all, a great hotel in a great city. And pricey but first class.

Reviews.Title: “A great modern hotel, well served and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Glengarry3007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a too-brief recent trip to Paris and was very impressed both by the service and by the hotel itself. A newish establishment, situated on Place Vendome, it is both clean and spacious. Arriving early in the morning (around 10am) we were nonetheless able to check-in to our room and checked out only after 3pm on the day of departure. The staff were friendly and relaxed. The rooms are modern in design and large, the beds huge - far beyond King-size. Our room had a small balcony looking onto the street and Paris on a cold but bright morning is best viewed with a glass of champagne in hand from ones hotel balcony. An auspicious start to our stay. The hotel doesn't have a pool, which slightly disappointed my companion, but the positive vibe at the hotel more than made up for this. Breakfast was wonderful (an adjective I very rarely use in reviews of hotel restaurants), with the Eggs Benedict scoring high for us both. A refreshing point was also that the breakfast restaurant wasn't overfull, which is sometimes the case with city centre 5-star hotels. The only slight qualm came at the end when presented with a bill for 102 euros for our breakfast for two. Surely some mistake? Apparently not. This notwithstanding, it was an excellent experience overall. I will definitely repeat the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: TheFielding
Reviews.Content: I had written a long detailed review but unfortunately my delete button stuck and it was completely erased. I'll go over the highlights and lowlights of my experience. This hotel exudes opulence and you can tell it from the moment you walk in through to the bathroom scales in the rooms. I was travelling on an award stay and even though I was lost revenue to them at no point did I feel treated that way. I was welcome, given early check-in, and even provided a welcome gift for being a HGP Platinum (not a listed benefit of Platinum). The rooms and bathrooms and ridiculous, but in a good way. The only two things I disliked about my stay were that it was not longer. The other complaint is that it took three calls and thirty minutes to get a US to European power adapter sent up. I normally travel with them but as I had not originally planned to go to Europe on this trip I didn't have one in my bag. I didn't spend much time in the room since I wanted to use my day and a half in Paris to sit in the Tullieres Garden and read, enjoy some Berthillon, and just take in the city where I lived for a year as a child. I loved my time in Paris and at this hotel and around Paris but luckily for me, Berlin was even better. If you can afford it I see no reason not to stay at the the Park Hyatt Paris - Vendome, really a great place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location of Paris”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last May while visiting Paris over the weekend. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Place Vendome and the Paris Opera House. We took the metro at the Paris Opera stop. The hotel is lovely, elegant, and quiet. The rooms are beautiful; I was enamored with the Rodin-esque sculptures on the light fixtures and door handles. The staff was warm, welcoming, and helpful. We had difficulty getting a taxi to dinner one evening, so we took the metro around the city during the rest of our stay. We are returning to Paris for our honeymoon and are looking forward to staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first impression but the details....”
Reviews.Author: Christian1616
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for business purposes for 2 nights. The hotel is wonderful located between Opera and Place Vendome, the most prestigious square in Paris. Service was very attentive throughout the whole stay, no service member that didn't greet me. I used the Bar where the service was a bit slow, although it was not particularly full, but friendly and competent. The decoration throughout the hotel and rooms is contemporary. The rooms are very spacious but the bathroom is quite strange with a bathtub in midway between shower and the rest of the bathroom. There is also a mirror and a small sink IN the shower which gives a strange feeling. All in all the rooms are nice but not very practical as I couldn't find any plugs near my bed or elsewhere in the room besides the closet. My Laptop which is not the largest (15") didn't fit in the safe neither. The breakfast buffet is colourful and gives a good choice, it is definitely worth to pay the 5 EUR difference between continental breakfast and buffet. A good hotel to stay athough you'll find other hotels that have more soul and more attention to detail in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Five Star Hotel But Needs More Experienced Employees”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I stayed four nights at the Park Hyatt Paris - Vendome in January. The hotel's rooms, restaurant, and lobby are, indeed, elegant - five stars. The entire hotel is tastefully and beautifully designed and decorated. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The restaurants are excellent. Every reasonable request is granted. And, very importantly, the Park Hyatt's General Manager is highly dedicated, professional, and extremely responsive. So, what then is the Park Hyatt's one major weakness? None, if you are want complete anonymity and do need to be greeted and/or assisted on occasion by seasoned and knowledgable employees. However, if you are someone who travels frequently to the same city and likes to always stay at the same hotel, the Park Hyatt may not be the best choice. Here, then, is what appears to be the management and business model of the Park Hyatt Paris - Vendome: Hire extremely attractive and very intelligent young men and women between the ages of 23 and 27 fresh out of a university and/or with little or no experience, keep employment costs down, and use the Park Hyatt Vendome as a training center for hotel career development. The average age of the Park Hyatt Paris - Vendome employee is, literally, thirty years (a fact learned from management). And, the only reason the average is thirty and not twenty five is because of the significantly older housekeeping and maintenance staff. Also worth noting is that almost the entire staff at the Front Desk, Concierge Staff, and Restaurants are not culturally diverse. One has to wonder why the Park Hyatt has placed such importance on the way its employees look as it would seem to be no accident that almost every young man and woman looks like they stepped out of a fashion magazine. Does one have to be beautiful or handsome to land a position on the lobby floor of the Park Hyatt? Would an average looking , highly intelligent person somehow detract from the decor of the hotel? I think of my daughter. Despite her proven academic excellence, maybe she would not be attractive enough to work in an entry level position at the Park Hyatt if she had an interest in hotel management. The real problem, though, with having such an extremely young staff is that their intelligence, politeness, and well manners is no substitute for experience. Equally important, it was obvious that all of the young people working at the Hyatt are following such strict Hyatt rules that they are very afraid of making any mistakes. The result is an uptight and unrelaxed staff that is too nervous to be themselves and to be, naturally, friendly. Youth also contributes to an understandable lack of knowledge and often wrong advice on Metro directions and distances to reach a location. Were this a four star or lesser five hotel with a large bar and/or a night club, the hotel personnel would be perfect for a Starwood W Hotel. All of the above may not matter to the one time visitor. But, I would think the lack of experienced hotel employees undermines repeat guest visits. In this respect, Hyatt is penny wise, pound foolish. There is no substitute for experience and this is where the Park Hyatt's business model undermines its potential for being one of the truly great hotels of Europe. What is needed at the Park Hyatt are, at least, three to five older and necessarily experienced individuals, in positions of mid level management. Hiring more experienced individuals will not only provide better training and mentoring of the young staff but will provide a more relaxed and friendly environment which guests on business rate as an extremely high priority. The most beautiful hotel structure in the world is no match for a five star hotel with an experienced staff who will remember repeat guests and who, ultimately, become the single most important reason why guests return time and time again on business to the same hotel. Given the average age of the Park Hyatt's staff, turnover, by necessity, will be significant as one young person is promoted through the Hyatt organization or joins another hotel management company, and is replaced by an even younger and less experienced individual. In summary then, the Park Hyatt is a true five star luxury building where the first time visitor should be pleased. Every young Park Hyatt employee is well meaning, polite, intelligent, and helpful. But, they are also very afraid of making a mistake and appear alway on-guard to be sure they are not deviating from the Park Hyatt rule book. The resulting ambience of the hotel undermines the potential for the Park Hyatt Vendome to be the hotel of choice for the frequent visitor to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Will58
Reviews.Content: This Park Hyatt has a wonderful calming feel about the place - from the warming signature fragrance to the luxurious but minimalist decor. The service was excellent; every single request (and I had many) was easily and quickly dealt with by a friendly world-class concierge team. The location of the hotel is fantastic - steps away from Vendome. The room was generous in size for Paris, had an amazing bed and a wonderful bathroom. The downside with respect to the room was that I found it to be quite dark, there was only one smallish window and the decor is dark. But, given everything else, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “memorable”
Reviews.Author: ronkeke
Reviews.Content: the rooms are spacious and comfortable modern and chic decor water pressure in showers excellent the location is excellent for high end shopping staff service is great: warm and professional lobby service in managing guests and friends of guest is warm handling baggage at arrival and departure prompt accessing taxis too was made easy with the outdoor staff who pay attention and acknowledge you as you go i and out of the hotel i would stay here every opportunity I get.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing...”
Reviews.Author: AgaSzSz
Reviews.Content: Loved it all the way. Fantastic location, staff and great property. What's not to like. Great experience....

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: FLLtourist
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in January. It's a beautiful contemporary hotel. Unfortunately, there should be more to an excellent hotel than the physical. The check in process was exceedingly slow. I have no idea what was the problem, but it took forever for the front desk to give us our room keys. It truly was one of the longest processes I've gone through. But once completed, the front desk person did take us to the room and show us around. The room, a Park King Suite, was gorgeous. The bathroom was luxurious, complete with a heated floor and a mirror in the shower for shaving. There was plenty of hanger and drawer space. However, there is no coffee maker in the room. I'm one of those people who cannot function before his first cup of coffee, so I was not thrilled. I was told they will get them over the next few months... and they could not provide me with one until then. Internet Wi-Fi service was spotty. Luckily, I didn't have any real time constraints in what I had to do online, but it was frustrating to constantly lose the ability to connect. And, of course, there's an additional 19â‚¬ charge per day. Throughout our stay, the staff was, for the most part, courteous. However, we never felt special or unique. I expected more from this level of hotel. We were totally ignored by the breakfast hostess for over 1 minute while she spoke on the phone... Not so much as a glance at us to let us know she knew we were there or she cared. We finally walked by her and beckoned a waiter to seat us. Unfortunately, that morning it also took a long time for someone to take our breakfast order (and the restaurant was fairly empty). Mind you, I hadn't had my coffee yet, but even taking that into account service was slow. And ultimately we were charged an extra 3â‚¬ because I wanted milk for my coffee. Really? As I said, the hotel is very nice. My complaints have to do with the level of service for the price. It may not be much, but a token nightly snack in the room would have been a nice touch... We didn't even get a chocolate on the pillow. I was also surprised that I didn't get a bill to review prior to checkout. We had an early flight to catch, so in my pre-caffeinated condition, I was reviewing our bill for the first time at checkout. I found an error which was quickly corrected. Providing the bill the night before would have been easier and less stressful. Finally, I felt that the hotel overcharged (gouged would be a more correct word) for any of the extras arranged through the concierge. The car service markup is astronomical. A 10â‚¬ taxi ride from Gard Nord to the hotel would have cost over 100â‚¬ for a car and driver. The trip to the airport (60 - 80â‚¬ by taxi or numerous other car services) would have been 240â‚¬ through the hotel. I'm sure it's a very courteous driver and lovely Mercedes, but it's not a helicopter. A 300% markup is just plain greedy. Bottom line is that it's a very nice hotel in a lovely part of town. But I don't think the level of service matches the price, and frankly I resent the gouging for the services through the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Another fab Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Jan_ATL
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel right in the heart of Paris. We stayed for two nights over New Years Eve using GP points. Rooms are very well appointed. Staff very helpful. Bar very expensive, but then it is Paris and it is a Park Hyatt so c'est la vie. It's very easy to walk everywhere from here, or if not the Opera metro is 2 minutes away. There are some great walks on Frommers. We did Marais and Latin quarter and they were a great way to see each area. Also don't miss Pere-Lachaise cemetery, which is 15 mins out of the Metro. Flying in to CDG the Roissy bus goes direct to Opera and the hotel is a 5 min walk from there, though feels a bit cheap arriving at such a nice hotel on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDaisy
Reviews.Content: Seven wonderful nights, staff was friendly and knowledgeable, service was excellent, nice fitness room, and spa area. Location is excellent for touring, shopping and lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hyatt Paris - Vendome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaww0502
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most beautiful hotels we've stayed in. They have their own signature fragrance that permeates every breath you take; in the soaps, shampoos, conditioners, and lotions you use; and even in the chocolates you eat. That was so intriguing to me. The service is without a doubt superior to any! They went out of their way to make our stay fabulous. The room was well appointed with everything we needed or wanted; however do be very careful when opening the "mini bar refrigerator" as if something is bumped it registers as being a purchase. We received a daily newspaper of our choosing. Because we were diamond members we enjoyed the daily free buffet breakfast which was superb. The hotel is near the Opera House, a 10-minute walk to the Louvre, and in close proximity to a lot of wonderful designer shops. Everything was exceptional and we would love to go again, especially to such a wonderful hotel with such an incredibly kind, thoughtful, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “swanky”
Reviews.Author: ramblinAmerican
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris for five days and while this was not my first choice for a hotel (the one I wanted to stay at was booked solid) due to the high price for a regular room I figured I'd bite the bullet forget about the price and book. The regular room I had was very nice though I do think for such a high price higher thread count sheets would have been nicer for the bed instead of simply a comforter sort of thing which wasn't as soft as it could have been. The hotel itself is really nice and I found most of the staff to be very friendly and helpful especially those at the concierge station (but that is their job). It is pricey but the services at least for me were excellent so I really have no complaints other than that minor one about bed sheets. If I stayed here again and had the money I would probably upgrade to a nicer room if possible but over all very satisfied. I will say I tend to be a bit biased when it comes to park hyatt's as I haven't had a bad experience at one yet and usually my experiences are far above average at this chain. For gods sake though don't eat in the hotel. Not that the food is bad but it is paris always eat out in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable - Proposal in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mcavin
Reviews.Content: Just another message giving accolades to the excellent PH-V management, staff, concierge, restaurant, and spa staff! What a wonderful, relaxing, and altogether amazing experience. My fiancÃ© and I just returned from Paris yesterday, after spending five lovely days in a Park Executive Suite with a balcony overlooking Rue de la Paix (complimentary upgrade after using 33k/night GP redemption for a Park Suite). Mind you, I used points (instead of the 1000-euro+ cost/night)... Prior to my arrival, I notified the management that Iâ€™d be proposing to my to-be-fiancÃ© during our time in Paris. When I arrived, the manager quietly asked me what day/time Iâ€™d be proposing so that she could have a complimentary bottle of Champagne (turned out to be an exceptionally nice bottle) waiting for us after the proposal. The Diamond breakfast was simply outstanding (Iâ€™m really missing it today); servers remembered everything day-to-day. The Concierge helped with booking advance NYE tickets and made restaurant recommendations on the other nights â€“ even got us night-of reservations to the joel robuchon Lâ€™Atelier restaurant. On our last night, we returned very late to PH-V, and we were greeted by Gil (a concierge). Gil had not seen us, we had not met him; in fact, I think heâ€™d not been working for the few days prior. Before we said anything, Gil welcomed us each by name (my fiancÃ©â€™s name wasnâ€™t even on the reservation) and he congratulated us on our engagement (my fiancÃ© had a glove on!) â€“ then he asked how he could help us. Our friends stayed on my points at the Intercontinental Le Grande, and (although itâ€™s still nice), what a markedly different (and better) experience it was to stay at the PH-V. Truly an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A little stiff-”
Reviews.Author: fabiab1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a great location. near restaurants and shopping. Easy subway access. I did find the staff a little stiff. The room was comfortable, not the best I have been in. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was luxourious. Rain forest shower head was fab at the end of a long day. Inside courtyard view meant night was quiet, but not a great view. The dressing room was a nice suprise.. Elevator was fab as the "lifts" in Europe make me claustrphobic.

Reviews.Title: “A Stain on Hyatt's excellence ... TBA !!”
Reviews.Author: 7DegreesOfWonderment
Reviews.Content: You may notice that many of my contributions here are highly positive ... I have waited one full year to voice this strongly negative opinion on this property..... An organized stay last December resulted in lots of frustration and disenchantment in the brand, less for me than those I invited to stay. One example ... a daily battle of will and nerves ... for adequate and comfortable seating for pre and post dinner drinks! Staff constantly refused our party of 3 access to our chosen seating in the often empty lounge area either side of an open fire â€¦ preferring to give precedence to tables, in my view, fictively "reserved" for non-resident larger parties etc etc.. well dressed, freshly showered and presentable â€¦ we were daily refused the ability to sit where we preferred in an empty lounge area (even on a guarantee of staying only briefly pre-dinner) and could only sit at small tables with straight back chairs only to watch the seating we sought to enjoy languish empty. This is increasingly a problem for Hotel residents across the globe as, often. â€¦ once we residents (paying guests) leave our rooms we are cast to the winds of the public spaces of our â€œHome from homeâ€� being monopolized by non-residents. The rooms are small and a tad shabby compared to other properties. The wrought iron sculptures throughout are almost fear stirring. The room I booked was searingly over heated and it took three days to have the offending heater fixed etc etc. Accommodation and ESPECIALLY breakfast and all lobby ordered refreshments are exorbitantly overly priced ans served with sloth . My parents had come around to understanding and agreeing with my love of Hyatt over Four Seasons up to this trip, after which the vowed NEVER to return (to this property at least). Staff, with the sole exception of Marie in Guest relations (who was excellently helpful), were the most blaze, disengaged and rude of all and any Hyatt staff I have encountered anywhere. Professionally I had put business contacts at this property but have since ceased to recommend it. Pity that such mismanagement simply compounds the clichÃ© that travelers have of Paris and its residents .. it should be doing the opposite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: PekoePeony
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for two nights for enjoyment, following a four night stay at another nearby hotel for business. The entrance of the hotel is a bit small and discreet -- our taxi driver drove right past it -- but once inside, the hotel is quite luxurious and elegant. Our junior suite was lovely and spacious, with a king size bed, multiple windows overlooking the glass-enclosed courtyard, electronically controlled shades, fireplace, separate tub/shower area, and a dressing area / bathroom about the size of my bedroom at home! Of course welcoming John Paul Hevin chocolates and a bottle of wine helped too (my husband is a Hyatt Diamond member), as did the very generous amenities in the bathroom including our own loofah. We visited the spa which was small but very nicely furnished, though the jacuzzi wasn't working when we were there, and the jacuzzi/sauna/steam rooms were co-ed. For Americans the (outrageously expensive) breakfast buffet can be a little disappointing, especially when compared to the lavish English / Asian hotel breakfast buffets, but service was very polite and comprehensive. You need to pay for wifi but it's free for diamond members. The location of the hotel is good, located a short five minute walk from the Opera metro station, as well as within walking distance of Printemps, Galeries Lafayette, the Ritz, the main Chanel store, and the upscale shops of the Rue St Honore. The hotel is pricey, but you feel the money is well spent (five stars all the way) and I would definitely stay here again if I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, attentive hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimmyDub
Reviews.Content: Have traditionally stayed at the Plaza Athenee in Paris but the prices have now become just too much. Tried the (still expensive - but less so) Hyatt and was very impressed. Much more modern in style that the Plaza Athenee - but stylish nonetheless. Great well thought through room. Nice courtyard for a drink/something to eat. Excellent location. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris with family.”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay in Paris and my first at this Hyatt - without a doubt the best hotel yet. I do not see my self staying anywhere else on future trips. (I have stayed at the Hilton and Intercontinental in the past) This trip was 2 adults and 3 children with two adjoining rooms for 4 days/3 nights. Upgraded to suites at checkin and treated like royalty. Large rooms, huge closet with 3 total restrooms. Main bathroom had a two sink setup with a wonderful shower/tub situation. Unusually large rooms for Europe. The children and I especially enjoyed the street view. The location is of course excellent. Close to many of the things worth doing in Paris. One day went long so we decided to eat in our room - FANTASTIC food and service. They set it up like a 5 star dining room - perfect place settings and overly accommodating. Simply wonderful. The friendly/helpful service at this location really is second to none. I wish I was returning sooner than I am...

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT hotel in a PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: chilichocolate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last Dec 2010 for 4 nights(you'll note it says Dec 2011 agaist this review which is because trip advisor made this a mandatory selection and only listed the months of this year). We were very impressed by the service, hotel in general and our magnificent room. I loved the outdoor courtyard style seating where we selected tea and hot chocolate from their menu. My husband enjoys his cigars so it was a good spot for he and I to sit while he smoked and I sipped on my delicious hot chocolate. Dining prices are a little too steep so unless you really want to try the restaurant or bar then do so otherwise your best bet is to venture out onto the streets where youre sure to find many places to dine at. As an example, we ordered 3 espressos at the bar and paid something like 25 euros, nowhere next to what I'd expect to pay in Australia! Ofcourse everytime you order coffee or tea it is accompanied with a plate of exquisite truffles, which we felt was what we were actually paying for! The room we stayed in was gorgeous, nothing we could fault about our room! I've posted some pics below. We opened one of our 2 windows, climbed up onto the ledge and out of the window onto the balcony to find a wonderful view of Place Vendome. The staff were very helpful with any touristy questions we had and gave us some good tips on how to ship our 33 bottles of wine back to Australia! They even helped us carry the bottles over to the post office which was such a nice gesture. The hotel is in close proximity to great cafes and restaurants and attractions. We walked everywhere. I think we only caught a cab once after wakling for hours and ending up a fair distance away and were too cold to brave the walk back. Its a short walk to the louvre, eiffel and of course the christmas markets which were on at the time(definitely worth a visit!) I hope my review helps. You'll never feel like you want to leave this hotel. It's a little pricey so best to stay here when its not peak season I guess. We were fortunate to book a few nights using our Hyatt points...and thank God for those points otherwise we'd still be there trying to pay it off ;)

Reviews.Title: “Modern, understated luxury in the heart of paris”
Reviews.Author: travelkat123
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern alternative to some of the grand palace hotels but are unwilling to compromise on service and luxury then the Park Hyatt is for you. The service is smooth and professional, of particular note is the way we were looked after by their Guest Relations Manager Marie Hiedelin, the location cannot be beaten and the rooms are suitably luxurious and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious 5 star hotel in good location and high prices”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn
Reviews.Content: It was not flawless (especially concierge was not able to handle our luggage), but on the other hand their suggestion on the restauran near suited us well. The first room suggested was in the attick and not of our taste (a labyrinth with low ceiling), but that could be fixed. The breakfast in the restaurant was a bit erratic and also noisy, and the waiters were fuzzy, so at the worst case just a hand appaired from behind and in a swift the coffee cup disappaired. However, the quality of the food in the breakfast was excellent. The room (park suite) was just fantastic, we had a view to the back street, which looked very Parisian (we could see the roof of the Garnier Opera from the small terrace). The bathroom was luxurious (a double vanity, a bathtub, a rain shower) and connected to a very practical and large walk in closet. There was also an additional toilet available. And the location is just unbeatable: you can walk everywere and there are good connections by metro and even with the airport bus to and from the CDG. So I did enjoy it, but if you are looking for a "romantic" small hotel in Paris, this might not be your option. I would give actually 4.5 stars, but this is not possible. The reason for this is the fact that a hotel of such a high price needs to be 110 % perfect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: UMassBSAM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the definition of etiquette and hospitality. From the moment we walked into the hotel, we had the most personal treatment from all of the friendly staff. Our bags were accepted promptly upon entry and we were immediately directed to the reception desk. Upon check-in, the front desk reception agent gave us a personal guide and tour of the hotel and our room. Our luggage arrived a few minutes after our tour ended, and it was a perfect start to our Paris trip. The bar was fantastic and they have some of the best trained and knowledgeable bartenders we've ever come across. Location - Very centrally located and about a 5-10 min walk from the nearest Metro, the Tuileries, and Place de la Concorde. Lots of very high end retail shops surround the hotel if that's your thing (Tiffany's, Cartier, Rolex, etc.) and the neighborhood is very well lit and felt very safe. Price/Value - For us, we were able to use points to stay with the hotel. On avg, the nightly rate for our room was close to $1250 USD/night. That's the only reason I rated it low on value because you definitely get what you pay for where everything was of the highest quality, but I'm not sure it's twice as good as say a $600/night hotel down the road. In the end, would we stay here again? Probably not if we had to pay cash, unless it was for an extremely special occasion and a short trip, but we wouldn't even consider any other hotels if we could use points again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for a price”
Reviews.Author: Kallang
Reviews.Content: Pros (1) Big, sleek, modern room (2) Room service food for kid was good Cons (1) No coffee house (2) Checkout was stressful. Had extended checkout to 4 because had young kid and taking Eurostar later but hotel receptionist started calling at 4 to chase us out of room (3) Getting taxi was stressful. Had train to catch but hotel was slow to get a taxi. The hotel staff damaged the taxi's equipment by chucking it into front seat with a lot of force. Taxi driver was not pleased (4) Hotel was crowded (5) Expensive. Not sure whether it is worth the price

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not cheap”
Reviews.Author: Goodtaste73
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, especially in Paris. I would say that generally the quality of hotels in Paris is poor. The park hyatt vendome is an exception. It's excellent. A lot of americans. You can expect to payâ‚¬660 per night for a decent room. Food is good, excellent. Good bar. Great location. Service is a bit spiky. Worth the stay if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tahnee85
Reviews.Content: Staff were professional and friendly without exception (particularly Lorraine at the front desk and Victor in the breakfast lounge). Park Suite room was incredibly spacious with a great bathroom with wet area and dressing room/wardrobe. Bed was comfortable however pillows not of usual standard. Breakfast buffet and table service great, exceptional concierge service - was able to book tours at short notice and advice regarding transport, attractions and tickets was always spot on. The only issue that we had was the location of the room was nearby a housekeeping service room (?) or service elevator, creating quite a lot of noise on a few of the nights during our 7 night stay even though a 'quiet room' had been specifically requested on making the reservation. However, when this was raised with the front desk, the response was more than adequate and sets an excellent standard for managing guest concerns. A last minute request for a dinner reservation at the hotel's restaurant, Pur was not a problem and well worth it - a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Still an emotional favourite, but simply a rip off...”
Reviews.Author: galatas0410
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Always try to stay when rates are reasonable. They are really taking people for a ride at 880 EUR/night deluxe room, the rooms are fair to below average condition, the furniture is peeling, there are chips and scratches everywhere, the carpet was torn near the bathroom entrance and I could not even plug in my notebook whilst working. Since i am using a power adaptor - the in desk cable management area doesn't have enough room to fit my power cord and the adaptor at the same time. This is still a great place for a weekend getaway - but not for business.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible.”
Reviews.Author: Gage L
Reviews.Content: Perfect. Although my girlfriend and I were travelling with our 2 year old daughter and 11 month old twins, we felt classy just entering this hotel. Staff treated us like royalty - other hotels really have something to learn from the hospitality skills the employees possess at the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely luxury: an urban oasis”
Reviews.Author: RLB_NYC
Reviews.Content: Like the other properties that share the Park Hyatt flag, the Park Hyatt Place Vendome shines. It's perhaps a notch below the Park Hyatt Tokyo, but it's nonetheless a superb hotel. Fantastic location on the Right Bank, perhaps not very "French" but cool and calming after a day in the city with its monochrome palette and contemporary style. Lovely bathrooms (separate soaking tub and large glass shower, double vanities and sink). In our room the closets were in the extra large bathroom - a little odd - also mixed feelings about the carpeted hallways (perhaps a little dated) and the preponderance of the copper/bronze statuettes/figurines; also wish the window treatments blocked the light a bit more (but that's a minor complaint from a jet-lagged traveller). The staff was above and beyond lovely - made GREAT recommendations for us for off-the-beaten track local restaurants. We stayed on points and were treated as though we were paying rack rate: a top-notch room and superb service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Property in Desperate Need of Maintenance!?!”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Paris Vendome is centrally located allowing one to explore and experience as much of Paris as they like on foot. Continuing on a positive note, this hotel certainly has the most exceptional and accommodating staff anywhere with special recognition due to the concierges as a whole. Our ten day wedding 'anniversary' celebration stay here was memorable, but.... It is a relatively young facility with decent sized 'deluxe' rooms for Europe accompanied by generously spacious washrooms. The rooms are well appointed with two sinks and a large closet in the bathroom as well as a large shower and soaker tub, but appear to have been neglected in terms of maintenance. (I attach pictures of the room and the bathroom as well as cracked floor tiling, cracked drywall and torn drapery.) This level of deficiency is completely unacceptable in a five star facility charging $1,000.00 per night. The stained carpeting was for lack of better terminology, "Gross!" It is a shame to see a room deteriorate to this level when initially so much detailed effort was obviously expended in creating a splendid environment. The deficiencies continue with a damaged and scratched main entry door as well as broken bathroom door and malfunctioning toilet and ripped silk drapes throughout.... Aside from the aforementioned, the room was comfortable and well equipped and with proper upkeep would definitely be worthy of a five star seal of approval. As a polar opposite to the room, the common areas were impeccably maintained in the most perfect of conditions and upkeep. The daily morning breakfast was superb with a level of service and quality beyond expectation and all standards. Similarly, the hotel's Michelin rated restaurant, PUR also provides an exceptional dining experience in both food and service. Pristine! I cannot reiterate enough just how absolutely exceptional the level of service was in the entire establishment from the bellmen to the restaurant servers to the doormen to the concierges to the chambermaids, etc. Literally each and every evening as we left the hotel for a dinner outing, the concierge rushed to our side sending us out to our destination in the hotel's complimentary Mercedes 'S' Class limousine service. Everyone went out of their way to ensure that our stay was as wonderfully perfect as possible, and in fairness, we did not complain about the condition of our room as we felt that a hotel of said caliber should know better.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: princesTelAviv
Reviews.Content: Since the opening of the Park Hyatt in Paris around 5 years ago , it is our first best and only choice for accomodation in Paris , we stay there 3-4 times a year. we usualy prefer the boutique hotels but this particular hotel , combines the benefits of both boutique and grand hotels. the rooms are spacious and elegant - ( we prefer the Park Suite ) , the dressing rooms are combined with the showers and are charming ,the beds are king size and the room fragrance is divine. the stuff - the concierge team of the hotel with the head concierge Dominique is the best there is !!! always willing to find for you the new retaurant .. or to get tickets to the best concert in town which is sold out ...they are never to busy and always friendly. the guest relations manager Melannie is amazing , she realy wants you to be happy in your stay , she will take care of all the small details in order for you to be satisfied . the courtyard inside the hotel is one of the nicest places in Paris for lunch or drinks.. the fire place in the lobby gives you a cosy feeling.. like home.. i love it.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary luxury in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in a Queen room. Asked for a room with a view and actually got one, facing the front on the first floor. The windows open which was a nice touch, and gave a great view of Rue de la Paix. Noise wasnt really an issue as the street gets pretty quiet after midnight, but the sound proofing wasnt great so if you're a light or early sleeper best avoid the rooms facing the front. The room felt bigger than 26-30 sqm, so they made very good use of the space. Bed was comfy as you would expect although I wasnt a big fan of the small square pillows, and they were also rather soft. The colour scheme gave the room a rather dark tone and the sculptured light fittings are an acquired taste . The entertainment system was great, decent TV with a blue ray player and plenty of channels. The bathroom was decked out in marble and "gold" faucets, but tastefully done. Wasnt a big fan of the Blaise Mautin stuff they stock but there was plenty of it. There's a business centre half hidden in a nook right before reception which gives comp internet access, and the PC on the left actually matches the english keyboard layout while the other one doesnt. There are only two machines however and plenty of folks wanting to use it. Charging for wifi on top of the high tariff is a little rich. Quite a few business travellers at the hotel, so there must be some rather generous corp expense budgets that survived the GFC. The reception and common areas were pictures of understated contemporary luxury. Its a very nice hotel but for some reason seems to lack a bit of charm and character. Im very low maintenance so cant really comment on the service, except to say that the concierge was friendly and professional, and most of the staff were friendly if a little stiff/formal - given the clientele however thats probably not surprising. The location is fabulous, there are plenty of cabs out front at all hours, and its a short walk to the Opera district where you can find upmarket department stores like Galeries Lafeyette and speciality food shops like Laduree and Fauchon. The metro is about 5-10 minutes away, depending on the line. Plenty of tourist traps in the area but also a few nice cafes in the laneways behind the hotel where the locals go for a good feed at a reasonable price. Its a 10 min walk to convenience stores in the area so be prepared to walk or brave the minibar if you get thirsty. The only downside is that everything is horrendously expensive, and you dont really get what you pay for. To be fair however, Paris aint cheap and it is one of the palace hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil - Elegant - Understated”
Reviews.Author: Lawthomas
Reviews.Content: at Place Vendome in a great neighborhood of elegant retailers, restaurants and the Garnier Opera. The courtyard room was pleasant and we loved the huge bathroom with window overlooking the courtyard. We couldn't have asked for a better location or hotel. The bright, airy, contemporary feel is a refreshing contrast to the nearby dowdy Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt Place Vendome”
Reviews.Author: pharitz
Reviews.Content: Had the wonderful opportunity to spend 2 nights at this first class luxury hotel and it lived up to it standards. Were very fortunate to stay in a suite on the top floor (6th) and it was so unique with sunken living room and then up steps to bathroom with separate shower and tub. Then onto the bedroom which was so well appointed. Staff and service were top notch and looking forward to our return. Being in the hotel business for almost 30 years myself just love when a property anticipates your every wish

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: travels_frequently
Reviews.Content: The central location of this hotel can't be beat. It is easy to walk right by it though, because the signage is directly on the wall in between the black store canopies of Van Cleef and Arpels & Mont Blanc which are more prominent than the hotel sign itself. Rooms are very clean with comfortable beds. Even though our room faced the street side, it was very sound proof and quiet. The rainfall shower and waterfall bath faucets are a elegant touch, but the scratchy thinner towels that are not very soft and stiffer toilet paper may damper the mood for North American guests who are expecting a totally luxurious experience in a hotel like this. Front desk staff are very helpful and polite. If the buffet breakfast plan is not included in your room rate, it is 42E. per person. No hot entrees are included in the buffet itself, but you can order them for an additional charge. Overall the buffet is very delicious and I would highly recommend the little round pastries with hazelnuts and pistachios on top of them. The buffet consists of good variety of pastries, breads, cold cut meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, cereals and yogurt. Coffee, tea, juice is included and served by your waiter. Although the service overall is very good, two things bothered me about the waiters. One is that some take the liberty of reaching right across your plate while you are in the middle of eating without saying "Excuse me, may I take that dirty dish for you?" beforehand. Plus, it is inexcusable when I see our waiter chatting up a single woman customer and french patron for much longer time periods and giving them much better service, while we are waiting for more coffee with totally empty cups for ten minutes. There was only eight patrons in the entire restaurant at the time and we had no problem getting our coffee cups refilled quicker when the restaurant was totally full. If you are on the run to see all the sights of Paris you can grab a sandwich at the Brioche Doree near by. There is charge for Wifi service, but there is also a business centre with two computers behind the front desk off to the right which you can use for free, if need be. The french keyboard has a different alphabet layout compared to its North American counterparts, so you will not be able to type out a fast email without making spelling mistakes. Paris traffic jams can be brutal, so if you don't want to take a taxi to the hotel during rush hour, consider the Roissey bus (10E. per person) which goes non-stop from CDG airport and drops you off about four blocks away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great area to stay when you are in Paris: So close to everything”
Reviews.Author: readyreader
Reviews.Content: We are Hyatt members and they have easy ways to earn free nights, so we used free nights to stay when we were in Paris. We also used free upgrades and had a suite. As to the staff, they kept asking me if I belonged there. I realize I was dressed to hike through Versailles but I did not look that bad! The location was the best part. It was so close to the Opera House subway and all the attractions. I felt we were in the heart of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Rounder in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: I had initially planned to try a number of the luxury hotels around the Vendome area, such as the Ritz and Mandarin. However after three days we didn't want to leave and ended up extended another two nights. Yes it's very expensive but not in comparison to the other top recommendations in the area. Great breakfast, restaurant and a special mention to the concierge staff who arranged our dinners for us.

Reviews.Title: “Gone way downhill”
Reviews.Author: Randy D
Reviews.Content: Actually staying here right now at a whooping $900 a night and will be looking to check out in morning due to poor maintance and rude staff. The AC in room is not working correctly and they came up to check it out said it is the vest they van do. The temp is set at 20c and it is has been at 25c all night. The internet speed is equiv to the old dial up modems and they will not fix it. The rooms are worn out-electrical sockets missing covers and linen is worn out and ripped! Smoking in room has left very foul oder. Was here 2 years ago and can't believe the change. Will never return.AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Quality but prices a concern”
Reviews.Author: Gastronauta
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay here - this really is a classy hotel (I still prefer its Hamburg sibling though) with helpful staff and a superb location. I was given one of the smaller rooms this time round (corporate rate) so not a lot of space but entirely functional to be honest and bathroom still spacious and lovely. Lovely courtyard and first-class breakfast buffet...much much better place than its neighbours (e.g. dreadful Westin) BUT...EUR 19 for wi-fi p/day in 2011 ? EUR 11 for a coffee...EUR 14 for a small glass of orange juice....I understand location, luxury, exclusivity blabla but I think this is getting silly now. Above all, I fail to understand how an American hotel chain can charge for internet access nowadays. Hence 4* and not 5* which the hotel really warrants.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place Vendome: Lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Siciliangal
Reviews.Content: A bit of disclosure: my husband and I stayed seven nights in this hotel on Hyatt points, so we did not pay the $1000 per night rate. Having said that, the place was pure luxury. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our queen room was small but again, luxurious. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was huge. There was turn down service every night. The location is ideal; very close to the Metro and all the main sights. The spa features a whirlpool which was heaven every night after walking miles daily. The hotel is located in the Place Vendome, steps from all your high value shops:Cartier, Tiffany, etc. This is a very expensive area, but we never stuck around...we headed for the left bank for dinner most nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripramsay
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Paris is a beautiful hotel. My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights after a week of island hopping in Greece. We were welcomed by the front desk staff and walked up to our room where everything was explained. My wife hated the smell that had been injected into the hallways but it didn't bother me too much. The general attitude of the staff is definitely pretentious but there are a few gracious hosts here and there. We ordered room service for lunch one afternoon when I wasn't feeling well, big mistake. Without a doubt it was the worst chicken ceasar salad and club sandwich we have ever had. How do you mess those two things up? My wife's chicken was not completely cooked and still had skin on it in some places. We were shocked. My sandwich was just terrible in taste. Besides the bad lunch experience the lounge is very nice and the drinks were great. Our basic room was wonderful, clean and luxurious. I've been staying a Hyatt's and more specifically Park Hyatts a lot in the last few years. I wouldn't stay here again just because of our bad lunch and the general attitude of some of the staff. There are plenty of other great hotels in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Junkie
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite for 4 nights w/ points. We arrived around 15.00 and room was ready. Check-in process was simple, thourogh, and courteous. The desk agent escorted us to our room and explaind the room features and services availble at the property. Suite was bright with a standard sized boudoir; the bath was identicle in size (so space was not an issue). Decor is "French minimalist" which consisted of rich fabrics, two beds, sofa, two fair chairs, and a large desk. Very confortable! Due to status with Hyatt, full American breakfast wass included in the restaurant "Les Orchides". The restaurant was beautiful: hundreds of white orchids in planters and had a spacious and open feel. The breakfat buffet was of consistant high quality and good variety. Also the service was attentive and courteous. On the morning of departure the wake up call and coffee arrived at the appointed time.The check-out process was fast and polite. I was most impressed by the hotel on the morning of check out, when we alighted the bell man not only knew we orderded a cab, he greeted us by name, and best of all had my news papers ready and waiting as we were walking out. Location was superb: Tuileries garden 5 min, Musee de l'orangie 7min (a must for Monet lovers)Louvre 10min, Place Concorde 10min ALL ON FOOT. The experience provided by the Park Hyatt Paris was of typical Hyatt quality: consistant, warm, and efficient service. Tips: Fly into Orly (ORY) the entire airport is easy (customs, taxi, etc...). Buy a Paris Museum Pass( lets you access many sites and skip the que). If you have an early flight order the taxi the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Does it get any better”
Reviews.Author: stevens397
Reviews.Content: It's all superlatives. Magnificent Executive Suite, beautiful hotel in perfect location, fabulous staff, a breakfast buffet to salivate over. Going back in December and can't wait. This is how is should be done!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: so_traveller
Reviews.Content: There is not going to be much more in this review that hasn't been said already about the Park Hyatt Vendome. Location: Excellent location right between Place Vendome and the Opera. With various metro stops with a 5 minute walk, I think the hotel is really nicely located. Service: The services were professional and welcoming across the board. From check in to room service, the operation of the hotel is definitely well oiled and staff all very well trained. The overall feel of the hotel is posh but not stuffy. Food: The breakfast at Les Orchidees is very nice. The quality of the buffet items were very good (the fresh squeezed orange juice was memorable). Unfortunately, we did have the time to eat at their Michelin starred restaurant, Pur. Gym/Pool: There is a gym, but we did not use. It looked very small though, with basic equipment. I don't believe there is a pool, but the attendant explained that there is a co-ed sauna/jacuzzi area. Room: The room was not large, but beautifully appointed and with the wonderful high ceiling. We had the room overlooking the street on 2nd floor. The sound-proofing is very good as you cannot really hear the street noise. I especially liked the little basin inside the shower. Wished I had seen that first before remodeling our bathroom - it's a quirky but really good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service, great location, and memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sf903
Reviews.Content: Spent our honeymoon here first. It was perfect in terms of decor, location, and service. Turndown service along with water was offered daily, as well as breakfast. It's close to several train lines (opera, pyramides, madeline) and you can even walk to the louvre, park nearby, and more chill food places. This street is super safe, and a few doors from the Ritz. Pricey but met expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, will come back”
Reviews.Author: Liuyihao
Reviews.Content: We are so happy about this hotel. It's chic, tastefully decorated inside out. We particularly love the lights in the room, so beautiful. Service was impeccable, staff was genuinely nice, sincere and helpful, food was perfect. We have decided to come back each year.

Reviews.Title: “Styled out in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jodo
Reviews.Content: So this hotel was booked on points....which means our perspective is somewhat skewed. That being said, often the rooms booked on points are not necessarily the finest offered, so free doesn't necessarily translate to "good". That was the case here, where we were initially given a room on the first floor---overlooking a window washer and several motor bikes. (the bathroom was oddly placed in the main bedroom area....I'm sure a nod to the new minimalistic look sweeping hotel chains) That did not work for us, and this is where the 5 star attitude of the hotel came in. When I politely asked if another room---even a few floors up---might be available, we were given an early Christmas present....an absolutely gorgeous dormered room on the top floor of the hotel overlooking the inner courtyard. The room was one of the most interesting and artistically styled we've been in.....beautiful contemporary sculptures on the walls (I guess a signature of the hotel)...little nooks and crannies, .and the most elegant and yet user friendly bath suite we've ever had the pleasure of showering in. As if that wasn't enough, when I left my camera case at the Rodin museum (which I discovered one hour before leaving Paris)...the hotel concierge sent someone on a motor bike to retrieve it. (that would be Julian, by the way). I might add, 3 things sell a place, and the location was superb---around the bend from the Ritz...yet a short walk to museums, gardens, and the less expensive 6th Arr....where you could grab a bite to eat at the D'Orse's lovely dining room without blowing the travel budget. Ok, this stay was the highlight of our European adventure (although the Pulitzer in Amsterdam was also lovely)....Hope you are lucky enough to stay here.....preferrably inner-courtyard view.

Reviews.Title: “Take a deep breath”
Reviews.Author: DamianByMischelle
Reviews.Content: It is the bespoke scent that you first notice. It permeates every nook and cranny and it is pure luxe. And this sets the stage for the attention to detail elsewhere that makes this a sensational place to hunker down for a few days of very chic R&R. If there was anything at all to fault it was the bit where we had to leave and return to reality, everything else was perfection.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it _ do it. Expensive, but oh so worth it!”
Reviews.Author: fromsteph2u
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have a total of four credits at a Hyatt for applying for the Chase Hyatt credit card. When we saw this hotel was available we snatched it up immediately. Up arrival the superb experience started. They whisked away our bags upon walking through the door and we were escorted to the reception area. Our hostess who checked us in (Joanna) was wonderful. She quickly checked us in and showed us personally to our room along with highlighting specific details we should consider (such as where the outlets were hidden!). Truly, she has set the bar for what check in should be from a front desk person!! Now, as you can imagine this is truly a 5-star hotel. Do not expect ice machines on your floor or cocktails for less than 25 Euros in the bar. But if you do partake in the cocktails they are delicious and beautifully prepared. The rosemary walnuts are outstanding and, as expected, the service is impeccable. From check-in to check-out you will be treated like royalty. In fact, there was actual royalty staying there while we were - we even saw paparazzi. However, we were never treated anything but spectacular. If you have the chance - take it. Beautiful hotel, great location and get the bikes if you can!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip”
Reviews.Author: Mary K
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four with two young kids and arrived from the states in the early AM. The hotel did not bat an eye, got us a room right away and we were able to get settled in. Everyone was so friendly and nice. Perfect English from the staff who were very knowledgeable. A very refined hotel but we felt so welcomed with our young children and never felt out of place. Bravo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ncdoctooth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this unbelievable hotel last week for four nights. Everything about this hotel stands out: location, cleanliness, facility, and dining. The best part of all is the customer service. My wife and I were treated like royalty by the entire staff. Forget what you here about the French being rude to Americans. If you are polite and attempt to speak their language, they are some of the nicest people you will ever find. It just doesn't get much better!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: 1ABCReviewer
Reviews.Content: Not much to say really, its a good hotel, in a good location, fairly standard city hotel. Rooms were nice, bathrooms were good. The rooms on the first/second floor are noisy if on the road so we went for one higher up looking into the courtyard. Staff were as one would expect with the Hyatt - very good.

Reviews.Title: “C'est magnifique and more”
Reviews.Author: lovedisneyfam
Reviews.Content: In some ways, there are no words to use here. My experience was nothing but incredible. The smell, the decor and the feel of the hotel envelope you immediately. The bathroom with separate tub and shower, sinks, and closets are worth the price or points. I do need to say that Audrey provided service above and beyond. She helped me stay for points after multiple attempts to book and even further changes in my schedule. I had booked both paying and point nights, but had to change from to my champagne trip. She arranged a fantastic room and I believe that my Diamond status on helped, but was not the sole reason. I absolutely love this hotel and have added it to my top three of all timeI would and will pay the 600 Euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “IMPECCABLE”
Reviews.Author: vacationistaColorado
Reviews.Content: Impeccable everything..loved everything about the hotel, friendly staff, helpful service, spa, workout, room amenities, location.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: choubella
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. Loved the Parisian charm while being in a modern hotel. The room and bed was relatively big for European standards. The bathroom was clean, bright, and well kept. Everywhere we walked to only took between 10 to 15 minutes max, whether it was to the shopping area, The Left Bank or the Louvre museum. Just the location itself is worth the price! It wasn't noisy either consider it was right along a big road, Rue de la Paix. We had breakfast outside on the Terrace of the first floor every morning. Loved just about every aspect of it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every respect”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiResident
Reviews.Content: This is now considered by many to be among the top three hotels in Paris and that view is not surprising. The service is outstanding! It's almost as if the staff anticipates what you will ask for. Whether it's room service, housekeeping or engineering, all departments respond very quickly and efficiently. The food is very very good, the rooms are luxuriously large for Paris. The buffet breakfast is excellent; the concierge's knowledge and ability to obtain reservations are top drawer; even the porter service delivers at super speed. The property is very well located at Place Vendome, close to the Opera and has several good restaurants around. A great coffee shop/ patisserie (Kayser) is across the street. Rue St. Honore with the luxury shopping and the Louvre are both a short walk. My favourite Paris hotel. Expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Traval
Reviews.Content: We stayed at two hotels in Paris, and this one was simply spectacular. I am a Platinum member with Hyatt so we were upgraded to a wonderful deluxe suite. The amenities, service, staff, and location were excellent. I wish we could have stayed for a month. It is very high end hotel and within walking distance of higher end shops, Louvre, and other museum areas. Room service was excellent, and the staff was very friendly. The only slight problem we had was that the service in the lounge was a bit slow so after several minutes of waiting, we just went to our room and ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: ulical
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during a five night stay in Paris. I'll be upfront and say that the only reason we stayed here is because I used Hyatt points to book the room. I say this because there's no way I would have paid what they charge for a nightly stay. Not because it's a bad place, it's just that in Paris there are some many options and alternatives. Room: Top of the line. I think that since I used my Hyatt points we were sort of relegated to a lower tier room, but we didn't mind. Our room was on the second floor facing the interior of the building and actually had a pretty fair sized balcony, which we used occasionally. We were able to look down into a garden/restaurant that was pleasing to the eye. The room was pretty fair sized with a huge bathroom (almost as big as the actual living space of the room) and all of the high end electronic items you'd care to mention (DVD, Flat-Screen, etc....) Service: No complaints of any kind. Everybody we dealt with in the hotel was exceedingly polite and friendly. We checked in quite late at night and the reception clerk actually gave us a tour of the hotel and walked us to our room. In addition, since we had a late night flight back home, we were able to leave our bags in the hotel for the entire day with no problem and collect them just before we went to the airport. This was great because it allowed us to get one more full day of sightseeing without having to schlep our suitcases all over the place. Location: Unbeatable in a word. At the end of the block, you've got the Paris Opera and the Metro stop. Fifteen minutes in the other direction and you're at the Louvre. Also, we felt very safe walking here at all times of the day. We would start early and get back really late and never had anything that could be remotely considered a problem. Regrets: Just that we don't see ourselves staying in a place this classy for a long, long time. For those that have the means, this is an excellent choice in Paris and one of Conde Nast's Top 99 Hotels of the World.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with boutique feel - great location”
Reviews.Author: OneBigWorld
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November 2010. We loved the location as Vendome is quite an upmarket ares with lots to see. Enormous, luxury bathroom. Dressing area was a nice touch. Our room was quiet and the bed and sheets comfortable. Breakfast in the restaurant was superb and all staff we came across were friendly and helpful. Would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “What A Wow but need to win the lotto to go back !”
Reviews.Author: RhondaP13
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Vendome is a classy hotel, which you feel immediately as you walk in the doors. We were checked in and upgraded and then escorted to our room. The room was a nice size and it overlooked the courtyard. We never heard a sound. The bed which was king size was comfortable. The bathroom was also a nice size with a waterfall shower and bathtub. Breakfast was included with our room, and it is a blessing that it was. The prices absolutely were the highest we have seen anywhere. A bottle of water was 8 Euros, Coke 10Euros.. If our breakfast had not been included it was 106 Euros. I strongly advise making sure breakfast is included if you stay there. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. We did not encounter one unfriendly person. Actually the only place in Paris we met someone nasty was in the tourist bureau. The staff of the hotel greeted you with a smile each day, and even apologized if their English was not the best. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, because we liked to walk. We actually walked to the Eiffel tower which took us maybe an hour or less. There are shops and cafes close by as well as some of the Important landmarks. We loved the hotel, and the location, but as stated previously and In many previous reviews, the prices are beyond reason. If that is not an issue for you, you will love the elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit as nice as the first”
Reviews.Author: NomadNorth
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit (see earlier review 1 year ago). The experience was enjoyable as the first time. Pros - To start with, I had asked for the same room i had last time because I really enjoyed it, and they were able to accommodate. Big thanks :) - The food and drinks were tasty - The concierge was especially helpful chasing down reservations, confirming them, and help with directions and info - I had forgotten how much i liked the terrace for eating/drinking.
