It's nice to be inside the hotel but, also outside in the open fresh air of the terrace courtyard. - The room as expected was nice, with a great shower/tub area and two nice separate sinks - each in their own little area of the big bathroom - lots of space for putting way things. - hotel is extremely close to shopping, louvre, river , and walkable to other areas like arc de triumph etc. See earlier review 1 yr ago. Cons - My one request is that the room should come with an iron. They quickly provided one on request but its a bit of a pain to have to request it. Also the iron that was supplied didn't allow steam, so it didn't do a great job ironing wrinkled clothes . - Also the pillows are a bit big / firm in the vertical direction so they are not as comfy. but the bed itself is very comfy. would like to see different (slimmer) pillows. net: when i am back in paris again it will be my defacto home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay was better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: DKHNL
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome. I checked in early and was delighted when the agent checking me in remembered me from my last stay there 18 months ago. He was friendly, professional and welcomed me back to the hotel. Although, it was only 10am, he found a room for me. I was upgraded to a room on the 5th floor with views of the Eiffel Tower and the Opera. The room was large, modern, had a long balcony and had a great bathroom. While not large, the balcony was large enough to sit outside with a glass of champagne and enjoy the views. I loved the bathroom. This particular room's bathroom was as large as other rooms I've had in Paris. There was a ton of space with a great shower and bath area. I really like the bathroom amenities. The hotel provides complimentary Evian water. If you are a Hyatt Gold Passport member, you can order morning coffee or tea that's complimentary. I had coffee two mornings as well as a cappuccino another. The service is top notch. I found the staff to be very professional and friendly. Every time you come back to the hotel, you are welcomed. Everyone from the front desk staff to the people in the spa to the house keepers and bellmen were all really nice. It doesn't matter how you are dressed, they will treat just as nicely as someone dressed in an elegant evening gown. There is a small workout facility with treadmills and weights and a small spa with steam room, sauna and jacuzzi. It's a nice place to unwind after a long day of walking. If you want an old traditional hotel with lot's of character, this isn't the place for you. While the building is quite old, the interior is very modern. There's modern sculptures in the room that is not for everyone. The hotel is located on Rue de la Paix close to Place Vendome. If you like to window shop or have very deep pockets, this is a great place. The hotels in the neighborhood cater to an upscale crowd. The Park Hyatt clearly fits in well with it's neighbors. There is a restaurant and nice bar, but there's quite of bit places to eat nearby. The hotel is a short walk to Madeleine, the Louvre and other sites. If you have Hyatt Gold Passport points, this is a great place to use them! I doubt you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, you'll love it: Amazing place with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: robertt773
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at the PHV and the service; level of attention to detail was excellent. We are Plat members so we received complementary coffee or tea in the morning that was very nice, and internet access (for all devices (Mac and an Ipad) included with the status. The team at the PHV was wonderful! They always a polite greeting, a friendly smile and could not have done more to make our stay special. Itâ€™s interesting because they make you and feel very comfortable whether youâ€™re dressed for business, dinner or for a full day of sightseeing in Paris. As other reviews have noted, people come to Paris (or anywhere) for different reasons and this hotel does a fantastic job of treating each guest as an individual. They maintain the same level of service if youâ€™re in a business suit or casual. Itâ€™s a subtle thing and not as easy to maintain as one might think. The bathrooms were great with some European nuances (the shower had an extra sink in it) but nothing you canâ€™t adjust to. The amenities in the room, Blaise Mautin, do have a bit of â€œsmokyâ€� scent which I liked but my wife took a pass. Overall I would highly recommend the PHV and, upon our return will plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have ever been”
Reviews.Author: adamdamme
Reviews.Content: I paid so much money for hyatt. I know this Group from all around the world but here is so expensive. Evrything is high class, elegant. The hotel' s location is in the hearth if Paris. I think i will not stay here again ( expensive ) but everybody should stay one time i a hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: bamboola
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews about the PH VendÃ´me, I was apprehensive that I was setting my expectations too high and that somehow the PH VendÃ´me would disappoint me. No worries. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was almost as big as the room. The breakfast was one of the best that I've ever had - poached eggs, mango juice, pastries, Grandma's rich chocolate pudding - I can go on and on. Others have posted about receiving a bottle or half a bottle of red wine as a Diamond amenity. I received a delicious bottle of Billecart Salmon champagne. I don't know if this was because I am a woman (i.e. red wine for men and champagne for the ladies) or because I jokingly asked at check-in if my room wasn't ready because the hotel was still chilling my champagne. Kudos to Marie Hedelin, Guest Relations Manager, for running a tight ship and for her friendly professionalism. While she was checking me in, Marie received a huge bouquet of flowers - a gift from another happy guest. She must be everyone's favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Flawless”
Reviews.Author: B-KPU
Reviews.Content: Great stay... didn't like the toiletries and no phone in the lobby to make/take calls but that's it. Everything else was wonderful. Breakfast was included as part of elite status but another good option is Eric Keyser bakery down the street.

Reviews.Title: “breath-taking”
Reviews.Author: linguistchic
Reviews.Content: Great location and impeccable service. My husband and I stayed at the Park Hyatt Vendome on a recent trip to Europe. Our room was amazing - biggest room I've ever seen in Europe even on the 6th floor. The is a very beautiful, fancy hotel, probably best for business travels, not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: fortlove
Reviews.Content: This is a well runand servicedhotel witheven the standard rooms being excellent

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in every detail”
Reviews.Author: ALKDVS
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets service, in every way. It also has beautiful rooms and a staff that goes out of its way to assist guests. The room we were assigned (an upgrade) was spacious. It had every detail that we could want. The staff was delightful, and went out of its way to help. (Speaking French does help, though the staff is completely fluent in English.) The bar was terrific--if extremely pricey. In fact, we cannot fault this hotel for anything. It's just what a hotel should be. We used points for the stay, but I would make this my regular hotel in Paris if I could find reasonable rates for it--luxury does have its price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in Every Way: Location, Facilities, Service”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Gaburo
Reviews.Content: Just wrapped up 5 nights at the Park Hyatt. It could not have been a more pleasant experience. The location, just off the Place Vendome in the 1st Arr., is extremely convenient to all "must see" Paris attractions. Yet the setting is relatively quiet, considering its city center setting. The people at the Park were unbeatable in terms of going out of their way to provide attentive, considerate service. We particularly recommend Fabien at the Concierge Desk. As non-French speakers, we found the hotel to be very user-friendly. Getting the things we needed was easy, despite our lack of facility with French. The facility is clean and modern, both in public and private areas. We will return to Paris, and when we do, we will certainly return to the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DuncanF81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a magnificent room with a view down to Place Vendome. This is truly one of the great hotels in Europe. For a start it has a beautiful, very modern, quiet and elegant feel while the more traditional 5 star Parisian hotels I find to be too chintzy with their tasteless faux antiques. On top of this, the service is really outstanding all the way through the hotel. This great service began months before we arrived when I had several email inquiries with their reservations department. The breakfast was also extraordinarily good. And the house scent throughout the hotel is warm and beautiful. I'm only giving it 5 stars because they won't let me give it six!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff, Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: sbianciotto
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt Vendome exceeded all of our expectations for quality, service, and location. We had the privilege of staying at this magnificent hotel through use of Reward nights from our Chase Hyatt credit card, but we were never once shunned as one of "those" kind of guests by anyone associated with the hotel. We found all of the staff to be particularly attentive to our needs. Cheerful, helpful, knowledgeable, and delightful would describe everyone we encountered working in this spectacular hotel! Beginning with the personal escort to our spacious 10' high ceiling room with beautiful windows overlooking Vendome Place, to the delivery of complimentary Champagne for a special celebration for my 60th birthday, to the welcoming gift and personal hand written note from the Guest Relations Manager, Melanie Salas (she's a real gem!), no stone of superb service was left unturned. Someone from the front desk even came up to our room to personally help us set up internet services on our phones. We were treated like royalty at Park Hyatt Vendome, a compliment to both management and staff. Situated in the center of Paris, just one block to the Opera metro stop, with easy access to anywhere in the city, location is prime at PHV. Upscale nearby shopping and convenient local dining added to our memorable stay and the finest birthday celebration in my entire life! I plan to return for my 65th!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Alazne30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome for 2 nights in June over a weekend. It's in a great location in the centre of Paris, close to most of the sights and shopping. Nicely decorated hotel and room with a good ambience. The bed was one of the most comfortable ever and the bathroom was beautiful. Most of the staff were polite and helpful with the exception of one of the doormen who rudely asked "can I help you" on our way back into the hotel after we had checked in and gone out for breakfast. The Junior "suite" was a lot smaller than in the pictures on the hotel website (nice photo trick). Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: zhangshinyi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights using reward nights from our Chase/Hyatt credit card ($75/year fee and standard rooms we got were about $900/night so the card more than pays for itself). Certainly worth it--stayed in a really nice area of Paris, access to subways, close to the Louvre and Champs-Elyses. I even stayed across the hallway from Roger Federer (he was there for the duration of the French Open). Overall a great experience. The only problem was that the concierge was lazy and unfriendly. We asked for restaurant recommendations and the concierge never bothered to reserve tables for us, telling us that "all" of the restaurants on the street we visited were good; when we arrived, all of the restaurants he highlighted along that street were full and required at least a 45 minute wait.

Reviews.Title: “Luxary & amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Margaret-303
Reviews.Content: I still have the amazing sense of accommodation in this hotel. Location, room , decoration, staff , services .... all in a very high standards I wish to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joey965
Reviews.Content: Sitting at the airport waiting for our flight after checking out of the Park Hyatt this morning. This hotel is wonderful! Checkin was the smoothest I have ever experienced (thank you, Joanna), beds were the best I have ever slept in, bathroom was huge and the toiletries were lovely. Our room looked out over the courtyard and with the windows opened you could hear the pigeons cooing! The breakfast buffet was delicious and as Diamond members was included free of charge. Location is superb and use of the luscious spa is complimentary for all guests. While we were there, Lady Gaga was a guest and we actually stood 3 feet from her and got some great pictures. The nicest Hyatt we have stayed and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven”
Reviews.Author: rogerad
Reviews.Content: This is an incredibly classy property. I've stayed at the George V, and this is a modern alternative. Impeccable service. The bar is one of the best late-night hang outs in Paris, and a wonderful way to end the evening. The concierges are superb. I loved the sculptures that decorate the whole property. But the best part is the address.

Reviews.Title: “Superbe in any aspect of service, but it doesn't feel much a Parisian Palace”
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe2255
Reviews.Content: Highlight: I had a two wonderful evening spent in this palatial ranking hotel. Still, I felt as if I were in New York City instead of in Paris. This hotel suffices to be the flagship park hyatt, but it is not enough for Paris. Pros: The nice touch by Ed Tuttle in the lobby; unequaled size of a deluxe king for Paris; spacious toilet with heated floor; great textile of choice for both the toilette appliances and the linen sheet; the superbe location on the rue de la paix; the almighty reception with courteous and efficient staff; the must-try champagne breakfast in room; the modern and contemporary ambiance. Did I just mention the complimentary business center with unlimited access? Cons: The concierge sometimes doesn't deliver the same unequaled service. A very unpleasant surprise to have my purchase delivered to my own room by a valet with a "look" after a long stroll along the St. Honore. And I did not see the Parisian enthusiasm or the typical Parisian style in most of the staffers, though they were so achingly helpful, and incredibly courteous and motivated to deliver the service. The entire air of the hotel is a bit too American to me, along with the edgy and whimsical Tuttle's interior desgin in rooms and part of the public area. Conclusion: Through a special manner that I booked my room with a gorgeous price and thus I will definitely return. Or I'd still recommend hotel junkies with the budget to 800-1000euro for a room to remain at the old dames steps away (Hotel de Crillon, Ritz, Le Meurice, or Le Bristol) or to try either the Royal Monceau by Raffles or the about-to-open Mandarin Oriental, which is also steps away. A few words to the manager(s): You have done superbe job in terms of the management, and guarded the brand in a perfect manner. But I'd like to see definitely more character in this charming estate. And also, the rug-lined corridor on the guestroom floors might have looked chic in 2002, but it looks so dated and is continuously releasing the smoke it had absorbed from 2002-2005.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Conan8540
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed with our two teenage children for 4 nights. Although in rained most of our stay, the trip was fantastic and the hotel was a big part of our positive experience. This is truly a 5 star property with a fabulous location. A short walk to either the Louvre or Opera House and surrounded by high end boutique stores. The staff at both reception and concierge desks could not have been friendlier or more accomodating. Although the hotel was completely booked due to the French Open (Roger Federer was staying in the hotel while we were there), they accomodated us with an early check-in at 10:00 a.m. which was much appreciated after our long flight from the U.S. My only complaint would be the cost of breakfast.....48 Euro for an American breakfast. I believe that some of the room packages include breakfast which I would recommend. This was only our second trip to Paris, but I cannot imagine a better hotel option. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & expensive”
Reviews.Author: frogprince
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice room. Pleasant staff. Prices for food and drink in the hotel were crazy expensive. Other than that, I can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paris with the Girls”
Reviews.Author: BJD278
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Paris, my first time out of the country. The Park Hyatt is centrally located in the heart of Paris within walking distance to The Louvre and the Opera House. It is surrounded by restaurants, shopping and expensive Jewelry stores. The service was excellent, the concierge helpful and breakfast delicious. We did not have time for the spa but ate outside in their private courtyard everyday. Rooms are a bit on the expensive side but worth it if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dkc_chi
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights in Paris at the Park Hyatt. We were very pleased with this property! It has a great location and nicely appointed, smartly planned rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully designed sleek modern alternative to the other "Palace" hotels in Paris. The common areas are modern and the general atmosphere is refined informal elegance. The rooms are beautifully designed and furnished in a contemporary high design manner. Though I generally prefer more contemporary feel and atmosphere to classical or formal atmosphere, for some reason, in Paris, I think I would rather stay at a more traditional hotel. I have stayed at all of the top Palace hotels in Paris, and I feel something lacking at the Park Hyatt - it just doesn't feel as special as the others. For me, the service was not up to the Four Seasons George V or the Ritz or The Bristol- those places have a way of making you feel special, somehow seeming to magically know your name and make you feel like you are the only guest - the Park Hyatt lacks this extra something special. On the other hand, it is a very cool, discrete alternative to the more classic places. I also love the Vendome location.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarstenW2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true five-star property: Understated Park Hyatt elegance hidden away from the masses (if you don't know the hotel is there you would walk right past it) coupled with delectable food & beverage options and excellent, unassuming service. As a Diamond member, I was treated very well. This was my third stay at this property and I have thoroughly enjoyed every stay so far. The rooms are spacious, and as you would expect from a Park Hyatt, the bathrooms are huge and feature great toiletries (Blaise Mautin). If this property is within your budget, I would recommend it in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Will make your paris trip a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: xileanx
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hyatt Paris based on all the high acclaims and reviews I have heard from colleagues, as well as family. Many have said it was the best hotel they have ever stayed at. I thought it would be near impossible for the hotel to possible to live up to the enormous praise we had heard about it. However, I will say that EVERY facet of our stay was BEYOND AMAZING. The front desk swiftly checked us in and we were greeted by several friendly hotel staff all insisting that they were there to serve us. We were personally escorted to our room by a wonderful employee of the hotel who also checked with us throughout our stay to make sure that everything was going well. The room had an absolutely wonderful view and the decor was tasteful, gorgeous, and luxurious. The attention that was paid to all the small details well exceeded any of the other hotels I have stayed at. Room service seemed to be at the door the second we hung up the phone with them and the concierge was very helpful in helping us coordinate activities in Paris. The location is superb as well, it is in the center of Paris within a short walk from the Louvre. The hotel absolutely made our one-year anniversary celebration in Paris, as we were blown away by the splendor of the property, the service its staff provided and the location of the hotel. If it is out of your budget, this hotel is certainly the best place to splurge, and if it is in your budget, it is definitely worth every penny. I highly recommend anyone going to Paris to experience this hotel, as I am confident a stay at the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome will make your trip to Paris just as incredible as ours was!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Klocker
Reviews.Content: What an incredible hotel - the staff, the location, the rooms . . . everything about our stay was perfect. Kudos to Hyatt for creating a luxury hotel that doesn't feel like a chain but retains the professionalism required to run a place of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “It's all terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Jimi54
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the PHV for 5 nights during the first week of May. Been to Paris many times and stayed at several top notch properties, but we enjoyed this hotel the most. Service was outstanding, from the moment we arrived to when we departed...bellmen, front desk, restaurant staff, room service, concierge (great follow up)...timely, always helpful with a smile and nothing was ever a problem. The room was impeccable and spacious and the public areas are beautiful. We were told the hotel was fully booked but you'd never know it from the service levels we experienced. And an absolutely perfect location, almost in the middle of everything, but not as frantic as some other locations in the city. I've stayed at many Park Hyatts, but this has proven to be one of my favorite stays yet. We will be back next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable - Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: bluefan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful stay at the PHV. For comparison sakes, after a few days at the nearby InterContinental Le Grand (very nice reward stay as a new Ambassador) and Westin (poor despite being SPG Platinum), it was very refreshing to experience 5* luxury and be treated royally at the PHV. They really know how to treat a Hyatt Diamond guest. I loved the suite (booked on points), sculpture fixtures, Toto washlet, automatic window shades, high ceiling, Blaise Mautin bath products, friendly reception, escorted suite intro, hi-speed wifi, flat tv's and the delicious breakfast buffet with attentive service. Also enjoyed the steam room, sauna and jacuzzi in the Spa. I could probably go on and on (very good location, enjoyable bar, upscale public spaces, etc.). Only things I disliked were very minor: overpowering, spiced fragrance near the lifts; small, congested workout facility with lack of heavy free weights; firm bath towels rather than plush; and placement of dvd players which are too easy to inadvertently turn on. This hotel continually receives widespread industry acclaim, recently joining the elite ranks of France's Palace Hotels, and now that I personally experienced it, I can see why. Can't wait to return to re-experience hotel excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Pchhabra20
Reviews.Content: I used points to stay at this Hotel and while it took every single point I had it was so worth it. This hotel is so beautiful, the rooms are stunning. Prettiest hotel I have ever stayed in. Our balcony had a view of the Eiffel Tower...I couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay for my birthday. The staff were wonderful. Great location, surrounded by shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraPraturlon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hyatt Vendome with my partner after travelling around France. The hotel is true to Park Hyatt standards, the service was impeccable and every measure was taken to make sure our stay was memorable. Rooms were lovely, the bed was smaller than we hoped for but the shower room/ bathroom was a delight. The fitness centre was brilliant! The location is unbeatable, with a huge array of fantastic restaurants and bars in the close proximity. We would have loved to stay for Sunday brunch but unfortunately we had a plane to catch. I would highly recommend the Park Hyatt if you are looking for that little extra spark that the 5 star hotels often lack.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and hotel. Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: pilatesgirl01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern parisian chic yet, cozy at the same time. The staff treated as if we were there only guest, and they were there to take care of our every need. I would recommend this hotel to only those who love luxury.

Reviews.Title: “too many 'the hotel is full' excuses for bad service”
Reviews.Author: DFBLondon
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms (housekeeping faultless), good location, but let down by poor front of house service. We lost count of how many times the hotel 'being full' was used as an excuse for frankly pretty poor service. Some experiences: We booked a king suite to be shown a twin with a fold out bed made up. No big deal, mistakes happen, but the way it was handled makes or breaks a hotel. In my view it was poor - with the 'we're full' (so what do you expect me to do?) excuse being rolled out for the first time'. Not once did PHV admit we'd been given the wrong room (blatantly obvious as astartign palce to rebuild confidence). Painfully slow La terrasse drinks service - again 'but we're full' (So what? staff up to meet demand) Breakfast - at E90 I 'm fine with that - but the servcie and food needs to match. Manadarins, Four Seasons can do it (well), this hotel can't. No crockery at times, cutlery ran out (in a modestly busy service, which should have been predictable if the hotel was full) food ran out, ordered omlette (which was pretty poorly prepared and cold on arrival) turned up just as were finishing. So about 3/10 for breakfast. All in all, still a well located hotel I have used many times before, but based on this experience, management have lost the plot. Being full should not be an excuse for slapdash bad service. Here it is THE excuse all the satff seem to use. Perhaps the hotel's very arabic/nouveau russian money clientelle are less demanding. Whatever the case, for the same money and better food go to the Four Seasons Georges V instead. We will next time. (For mid rnage travellers, Rennaissance Vendome also 'works').

Reviews.Title: “the best in service”
Reviews.Author: hiluvr
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend and thank the entire staff for the help provided to us during our stay at hyatt vendome. We were in need of a wheelchair to help ambulate around the hotel room and we were provided with one immediately. It was made available every moment it was needed. Room Service kept our sports gelpack frozen every day per our request. The ladies at the spa were so gracious and accomodating; it seems the spa is being tidied up every 5 minutes. The front staff - bellmen - are true assets of the hotel. Five Star Staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMWPDX
Reviews.Content: Great luxury hotel with excellent service. Roch at the front desk was so welcoming, and Vincent is an excellent bartender. Believe it or not the best Spanish ham I've had is not in Spain but at the hotel bar!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service makes everything perfect”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_East
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights there over the weekend and week this spring and we amazed by the courtesy, professionalism, and warm feeling that the staff at the hotel provides to their guests. Marc Lesage was one of the nicest and most sincere customer relations specialist I have met in a long time and I travel 50 weeks a year. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are wanting to stay near the Place Vendome and do some serious shopping. All in all very wonderful experience. Aaron East

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: letsgofire
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! This is a very stylish place. The rooms and common spaces are very impressive. I definitely was able to wow the wife with this hotel. This hotel is conveniently located near the Opera subway station, and if you are fine using public transport you can get around Paris very easily. All this luxury comes at a price - everything is quite expensive here. Expect prices similar to the best hotels here.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Does It Right”
Reviews.Author: Kevinprin
Reviews.Content: The very best Hyatt hotel I have ever stayed in. Great location, right at the place be dome, close to so much in central Paris. Everything about the hotel is great. Quiet, very friendly and helpful staff, very nice rooms. Be sure to visit the bar, a bit on the expensive side, but well with the quality of service and drinks. The best place to sit is at the bar itself, the bartenders are both artists and scientists as they prepare cocktails, a great show.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious refuge in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cortez55403
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in March for a special birthday in Paris. Fabulous. Was upgraded to a suite via American Express Fine Hotels program. So, we had a bedroom, living room and 2 baths. Understated luxury in silk with huge limestone baths. Much preferred by us over the more traditional Louis XIV-XVI in France. Location in Place Vendome was tops for short walks to the Louvre, Palais Royal, Madeleine, Concord, etc. Service was wonderful. From check-in, through the concierge staff, to the doormen and room service. Couldn't have been better. Gym was adequate. Used the beautiful spa post-workout without fee (steam and sauna) but did not have a spa service. Cocktails at the bar were a highlight. This is a destination bar with renowned skill as purveyors of expertly prepared drinks. Best, most meticulously trained bartenders I have ever seen. Their expertise includes the classics (Martinis, Manhattans) as well as house-infused specials (smoky rums) for more exotic drinks. Cocktail crowd is half local and half tourists. A wonderful hotel for a splurge in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Garbo1982
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, comfortable beds, great staff, clean and attractive hotel, great room service. Cons: A little loud facing the streets and a bit overpriced. Well I must say that I was anxious at first to stay here since it is very expensive and the reviews are mixed. However, I found the staff to be very attentive and courteous, they knew me by my last name from day one, the concierge and receptionists were friendly and knowledgeable, the hotel room was attractive and quite (hint: donâ€™t get a room facing the street, there is no view and it is very noisy, get a courtyard view if you want it quieter), the hotel was very clean and well decorated. The maid service was fantastic. It was done twice a day, once in the morning while you were out and once at night when you were out again. They would lower the blinds and put the water by your bed at night and turn on classical music so when you entered it was relaxing. I am not quite sure if it was worth $1200 a night though. There is a sense of snobbery in the hotel from the other guests, not from the staff, but it could just be me. I also think the price of the food/drinks were way over priced. 8 euros for a coke and 50 euros for breakfast... Cut that in half and it is resonable The location was perfect and I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to ring in the Holidays!”
Reviews.Author: martinlucy
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent a week at the Park Hyatt Paris which was a real treat prior to the hectic Christmas holidays. The service was top notch. Our suite was spacious with 4 sinks and two separate bathrooms. We enjoyed the restaurants at the Park Hyatt or happily ordered room service each night as were exhausted from touring during the day. The breakfast buffet was delightful every morning and the staff was warm and friendly. We recommend this hotel to everyone due to the fantastic location as well as beautiful, low key accommodations. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: global_nomad_pacific
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with grandparents and 2 young children - 3 year old and 2 month old. The staff were extremely friendly, and helpful, the hotel provided all necessary kids items even a baby bath and baby hygiene products - i didnt expect this. Even though this is a business hotel, we felt very welcome with our children and grandparents the staff was very friendly. The concierge was very helpful in suggesting and making reservations at restaurants appropriate for our group - where we could fit in and fill comfortable with the kids. The location is superb, you cant get any better, we walked to the Louvre and the Musee D'orsay & shopping in the area is fabulous. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the heart of paris”
Reviews.Author: NomadNorth
Reviews.Content: Arrival * Arrived early from north america and the front desk staff were very welcoming. Took us down to the spa to shower and change while the room was being made ready. The spa shower had everything you could need and was very elegant - a nice way to start a trip. * Room was ready by the time shower was done. Room * Had a great room out onto the street - opening the windows was really nice for letting in the sounds of paris Staff * Staff was always incredibly friendly and helpful. Restaurants * Lots of informal spots inside to relax and enjoy a bite. A nice couch/lounging area, and also a really nice outside courtyard were my favorite spots to grab a relaxed but very tasty bite. * Food was very yummy, and service excellent. Location * perfect location, close to shopping, the louvre, the gardens and on and on - you can walk everywhere from here. Oh and angelina's hot chocolate :) Would I return -- Yep. In fact next trip already booked.

Reviews.Title: “...magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: hymaddy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Paris! I know something about Hyatt but when I arrived at this hotel I discover a world of elegance and pleasure. In the room, we found a bottle of wine and some chocolate. The Easter Day they put in the room even a Chocolat Egg made by the Hyatt Metre Chocolatier...wonderful...and delicious! The bathroom is very large, with a big shower and a big bath; very soft the bathrobe and also the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “ZEN HOTEL WITH STYLE IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: Thierry D
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt is 200 m away from the prestigious Place Vendome in Paris. Despite the narrow entrance of this hotel, it is a gorgeous place. Het hotel has its own designerâ€™s style and is really to recommend. I would describe the hotel as being â€œZenâ€�. It brings peace and relaxation. The bathrooms are particularly well designed, as bath and shower are in one. It is an incredible concept, I have never seen before. Each room as a spacious dressing, that brings a lot of comfort. I would recommend asking a room at the back or in the middle of the hotel, as the front rooms can be noisy. Breakfast is fantastic. It is a buffet style with a huge assortment of everything. I also had for the first time in my life a little bread called: coing-amman. It was a delight We had a wonderful time in the very cozy bar. Despite a high price, I can really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and staff! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mollamarie
Reviews.Content: A lovely, stylish hotel with marvellous rooms, bathrooms and decor. The staff was very service-minded and were so forthcoming and polite! We got a room with a view on a high floors as we asked for, and a bottle of champagne was sent to our room (we used our goldpoints for this stay), which was such a nice gesture. We will recommend this hotel to everyone! However, I due have one negative comment - the breakfast prizes are abseloutly ludicrous - we actually laughed when we saw the prize - 50 euros for one person for eggs. Also, 19 euros for a 0,33 beer in the minibar is shameless. I am more than willing to pay for service and good food/drinks, but the lunch we had in the hotel including a very good wine cost the same as a breakfast, and I find that odd....Worth thinking about....

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel - has it all: location, style and great service.”
Reviews.Author: jkbklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night recently using points and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. The location is terrific, the rooms and public spaces were lovely and the service terrific. The decor felt high-end without feeling overdone and stuffy. The room was spacious, especially for Paris. All of the in-room amenities were great - the linens, spacious bathroom, heated tile floors, complementary Evian, etc. Ordered in for breakfast and it was as I expected (though I didn't order much). If I'm fortunate enough to have enough points (or money) to stay there again I certainly will!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice deco, smugish staff”
Reviews.Author: Alexandriciul
Reviews.Content: I was there with a friend; the hotel looks very nice but the staff lacks professionality ; be prepared to be interviewed on such little details as where your credit card is issued or where you learned your french... felt as if i had to apply to get in.. was a bit disappointed; i filed a complaint which never reached the manager... and things like that... i don't know maybe when you're that big of a deal you forget the little things as politeness and respect.

Reviews.Title: “I want to be rich so that I can stay there longer”
Reviews.Author: XtinaY
Reviews.Content: Well if you are loaded and/or looking for some good place in Paris to spoil yourself or other half, this is the place. It's right across Tiffany's and right above Cartier. One thing tho is the lobby/entrance is quite small for such a nice hotel but for Paris that's about right. Location: Cannot complain at all. It's close to everything you possibly want/need to do. Room: Room has a very high ceiling (at least 9ft) and alot of mirrors. The room I stayed has a bathroom that's bigger than a living room. In fact the bathroom is almost the same size as the bedroom so that's a little odd. You get heated toilet...nice shower (no tub for me tho) and a weight in the bathroom (to keep yourself in control I guess). You get bottled water (Evian) everyday. They will service your room when you are away shopping and prepare the bed for you for the evening. They also replenish the bottled water, tidy up the bathroom before sunset. Bed: comfortable. At least I had a very good sleep that night. I am not loaded so I got to experience this hotel because my cousin has points to claim it...but sure it will be a treat if that's what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great five star hotel in vendome place”
Reviews.Author: scintilla1980
Reviews.Content: Room is beautifully decorated. Could be bigger for standard room, but ok for single guest. love the toiletries. Free evian water. Staff is very helpful but in general lack of efficiency. Breakfast selection is very limited for the cost of 42 euro. You have to pay an extra 6 euro to get two eggs. And they just cannot get the eggs done properly, crispy outside and tender inside, like most Asian chefs would do. And it takes 20 min to get it done!!! I just don't get it, it is a tiny room with less than 20 tables. And not everyone orders eggs. Staff in the breakfast restaurant is very helpful and nice. But lack of efficiency in general. There are at least 6 staff servicing. It usually takes a long time to get my request through. You have to order most of beverages from the staff. It looks elegant but not efficient. Anyway, my opinion. Very happy with bell boy, concierge and check in. Overall a very luxury hotel with moder contemporary design.

Reviews.Title: “Georgous!”
Reviews.Author: Reminsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hyatt Vendome with my partner on a couple of occasions and we both loved it! It is a great hotel with a perfect location just 2 minutes walk from the beautiful Place Vendome. The staff is very friendly and attentive and the lovely breakfast is served under the atrium surrended by white orchids- tres chic !

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Corporate”
Reviews.Author: NYC1952
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel and it's great. It's got the style of a hip boutique hotel with all the service, appointments, and amenities of a luxury hotel. Service was courteous, prompt, and thorough. Room is comfortable and spacious for Paris, and the location is unbeatable. Especially great is the e-concierge which allowed us to book all restaurants through the hotel by e-mail before we even arrived. And, the transfer service from Charles de Gaulle airport, though expensive, was seamless. Tea by the fire in the lobby was memorable. All around, a great hotel and look forward to returning. Only word of caution, our room faced Rue Volney and was quite noisy early in the morning with sanitation trucks. Next time, will request room facing courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Cool alternative to typical Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: max_umami
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hyatt for three days. The location and service were great. The common areas were very well done in a modern Europe meets Asia vibe. The rooms were also nice. A couple downsides - I had fifth floor room that had dropped ceilings on one side and was constanty hitting my head. The fitness center was vey small with few pieces of equipment. The spa was also small and did not have separate steam room/jacuzzi for men/women (shared). It was a little less pricey than the Four Seasons. Though I wouldn't have any issue staying here again, I would have probably stayed at the Four Seasons Geo V. I stayed there before and, if less than 100E different/night Geo V probably worth it. I liked the Park Hyatt much better than the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless!”
Reviews.Author: Dorado1225
Reviews.Content: Not inexpensive, but worth every euro. Rooms are beautiful; we had a suite and a regular room, and both were large, luxurious and spotless. There was some confusion regarding our reservation, as we utilized a special offer of a free night combined with a regular stay to insure that our rooms were ready when we arrived early morning. Laure Brovelli, a manager at the hotel met with us, apologized for the missunderstanding (our reservation was a bit unusual), and invited us to go about our day, and she would investigate and resolve the problem. When we returned after a long sightseeing day, Laure had taken care of everything, and made sure that we were well taken care of, including a lovely bottle of champagne, and other amenities. I travel quite a bit, and I've learned that problems do occur, and the best of the best are able to resolve issues effectively. Laure and the Park Hyatt are among the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baci2003
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in the Park Hyatt. The hotel is comparable to the Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental. The location of the hotel off Place Vendome is fantastic. You can virtually walk to just about all the sights. The restaurants in the hotel are very very good. We enjoyed the breakfast, tea time and the Pur restaurant. The hotel is very clean and the hotel rooms are spacious and elegant. The bed is just heaven. We had a room on the courtyard which was really nice and quiet. Service was perfect--very friendly staff. I would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, but poorly trained”
Reviews.Author: hjpnyc
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 10 nights at Park Hyatt Vendome. Location is great, decor is lovely, but the service is really far from a 5 star hotel. The breakfast is beautiful (well at 48 euros per person it should be!), but trying to get silverware, coffee or a check can take literally 1/2 an hour - very frustrating. The bar area is even worse. We were told one night that all the tables were "reserved" and therefore couldn't be seated even though nobody was in the bar, (and we were all hotel guests). Another night it took 45 minutes for someone to take our drink order. There literally wasn't a single day when there was not some sort of service disaster. All the staff are extremely friendly and it just seems to be a lack of training. There are much better places to stay in Paris at this price.

Reviews.Title: “occupying an unique niche in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hp1212
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Paris gets everything right, provided one can afford it. Given its reasonable size and popularity, the formula is certainly successful! The hotel's location is excellent, convenient for nearly all purposes, especially shopping and sightseeing, upscale, and safe. Our room overlooked one of the inner, medium-sized courtyards which made for a slightly darker but extremely quiet atmosphere. Apart from the upper floor outer rooms with balconies, I find this preferable as those courtyards are an integral part of the Parisian experience. The prevalence of gold-colored trim and the hotel's scent can surprise the first time visitor, and perhaps not suit more conservative customers, but it is coherent with the hotel's decor and image. Quality of fittings and bathroom is top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but the best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: VLAXKAMEX
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Amazing hotel but best of all was the staff they are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Refined and modern, great breakfast and service.”
Reviews.Author: elenatapiero
Reviews.Content: I loved the Incredible scent throughout the hotel by Blaise Mautin, including their toiletries. They have beautiful luxurious decor, while still clean and modern, you could really not ask for more in way of bed, sheets etc. The location is good for going to the Louvre and Tuilleries, you could pretty much walk anywhere from there and the metro is close by. Not a great area for quaint restaurants and nightlife, but easy enough to get to.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hunter747
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Park Hyatt Place Vendome. The hotel has a modern feel to it throughout. Our Park Deluxe room was very large by European standards, tastefully decorated and spotless. Despite being an older building, the rooms were extremely well sound-proofed. The bathroom was spacious with two vanities, a soaking tub and a large stone shower. The staff were all very helpful and most all had good English skills. Very professional and courteous without being overly "friendly". Before arrival, we had requested champagne and strawberries to be sent to our room one evening at 8 pm. As it turned out, we ordered room service that night at 730. The staff seemed surprised that I should even ask that they bring the champagne with the room service. Sort of a "why wouldn't we bring them together, we aren't stupid" kind of response. The staff knows what they are doing. We sampled most of the food options available at the hotel. The breakfast buffer is very large and the food quality was excellent. We had drinks in the bar one night and again the quality of the service, beverages and snacks were all top notch. Forgive the cliche, but we ordered onion soup from the room service menu. It was BY FAR the best onion soup we have ever had anywhere in the world. You might say, "of course they would have good French onion soup, duh" but let's not stereotype ! Everything about it was perfect. The onion soup at the Park Hyatt is on my Top 10 list of foods I would gladly get on a plane to have. We also ate one night at their 1 Michelin Star restaurant, Pur. The food quality was excellent (no surprise) but two aspects of the evening were a little disappointing. First, the flooring in the restaurant is wood. This made for a surprisingly noisy environment, principally from the staff moving about. Secondly, there were two larger parties with small children. The parents did make an attempt to control them, but the parties were louder than we were expecting. The location is excellent. Reasonable walking distance from the Louvre, Galaries Lafayette, the Opera House and easy cab rides or Metro to everywhere else you may want to go. Lots of shopping throughout the surrounding streets (clothiers, glassware and more). The spa is very good, but seemed to be underutilized. Overall, the Park Hyatt is an excellent hotel. Located in prime real estate in Paris (a block from the infamous Ritz), it is not inexpensive. But if the price fits your budget, you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: bella_oes1
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where to start with the Park Hyatt.... Having stayed at many hotels in Paris on previous trips from mid to high range, we used goldpassport points to stay for 4 nights at the Park Hyatt. I usually only stay at the Hyatt hotels in asia and tend to prefer boutique hotels in Europe however this choice made our last trip for us. What a fantastic place. From the common areas, to the room, the great room service and courtyard restaurant, everything was perfect. The brunch in the courtyard is highly recommended. I lost count as to how many Hermes bags I spotted at the tables, but you are never made to feel like a second class citizen if you don't have one. It was a great way to while away a few hours on a Sunday after we arrived. The rooms are a great size with dressing room (walk in robe) and large bathroom with separate bath. Every creature comfort is accounted for. The only thing I found highly unusual was the bar with the electronic monitor system, which registered usage as soon as something was moved and prevented you from putting your own drinks in. Very very strange for a high end hotel. You tend to find this in budget places. I guess this was their way of making you drink the ridiculously expensive water and drinks in the room (8 Euros for water!!!!) As a hyatt member, you also received a wine and chocolate welcome gift and free daily breakfast and internet (if you are a diamond member). The room service breakfast was excellent, though we only had it once as you otherwise cannot eat a thing during the day. These were lovely touches and it is so nice to be rewarded for loyalty to a hotel group. The location of the hotel is amazing. Right next to the Ritz and Place Vendome, with all the high end jewelry and clothing designers. It is also so close to Galleries LaFayette and their tremendous food hall. It is also easy walking distance to Champs Elysees, Louvre, L'Orangerie, Seine and pretty much anywhere on the tourist trail. Whilst it is close to these locations, you are a good enough distance away so you are not in the middle of the tourist belt. I would recommend this hotel for business or leisure travelers who want a high quality, well located hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious, friendly and simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: baconovich
Reviews.Content: I've been lucky enough to stay in many wonderful hotels worldwide but in terms of getting everything right, the Park Hyatt scored at the very top of my scale. For such a beautiful place to be blessed with such courteous, attentive, well-trained and 'human' staff is a credit to the management team. My room was beautifully appointed and the bed helped me get a good night's sleep. The bathroom was fantastic and very thoughtfully designed. Breakfast in my room was excellent albeit at the cusp in terms of price/value. I think the Park Hyatt delivers the highest standards possible without tipping one over the edge in terms of being 'stuffy' - for those who stay in wonderful hotels I hope they will know what I mean. This is not an easy act to follow and I was left feeling very happy. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is lovely, well appointed, and the staff was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: flygirl39
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend in Paris and stayed at the Park Hyatt Vendome. I typically do not write reviews.... but prior to the trip I read some from this site - about this hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay here. The hotel is lovely. It is well situated, and within walking distance of the Louvre. It is also located on the same street as several high-end shops (which is wonderful - even if you're just window shopping). The room was clean, nicely sized, and handsomely decorated. We stayed in a "queen room." Meaning, a room with a queen-sized bed. There was a large dressing area (with lots of drawers, a towel warmer, and plenty of counter & mirror space). There was a separate toilet area, and also a fabulous bath and shower room encased in glass - with its own sink. The amenities in the room were very nice. The bed was very comfortable and the bed linens were clean and crisp. The room was impressively quiet - we never heard a peep from outside the walls of our room. And with respect to the hotel staff? Wonderful. They were so friendly and helpful. Once I was checked in, the woman at the front desk actually left the desk - and walked me around the hotel. She showed me all the amenities in the hotel, as well as the room. The concierges were incredibly helpful as we made our daily plans, and the entire staff made it a point to greet us every time we encountered one of them. I had no issues with the room, but did make a call to request a power adapter. One was brought up to me immediately. I truly believe this hotel offers five-star service, which made the stay extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Incroyable Park Hyatt Paris”
Reviews.Author: ThetravellingG0urmet
Reviews.Content: Pur Delight in the Park Hyatt Vendome Paris MY favourite place to stay location wise is the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome in the eternally beautiful 'City of Light'. Here, the rooms and beds are so incredibly clean and comfy, only an insomniac cannot sleep here. The suites are magical and you feel like you just want to luxuriate here and not go out shopping or eating. They smell nice too because they have a special 'designer' perfumer to provide the shampoos, bath gels, etc... Eh bien, when it comes to food, the pristine PUR Grill is a dining experience you must try, if only once in your life. No need to go out and take the crowded Metropolitain subway or fight with impatient New Yorkers vacationing in Paris for taxis... Just go to the Pur Grill in the Park Hyatt Vendome... Life is short, too short to suffer bad food, bad wines and bad service. In the Pur Grill, you get good food, good wine and excellent service! It is like dining in a 'tent' with luxurious furniture and the highest quality food and exquisite wines. I won't mention specific dishes because the menu changes regularly. So just walk in and as I like to say to the Chef: Suprise me! After a fabulous feast, go up to your suite and live like a true hedonist and sleep like a cherubic angel. A good snooze is better than many things...zzzzzzzz INCROYABLE!!! ENJOY! The Travelling Gourmet PS When it comes to breakfast, the spread is so huge and so good...after breakfasting here, you can forget about lunch and dinner, unless you are a gourmand, but that's another story.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: fherwanto
Reviews.Content: Super excellent hotel !! Great service, great for honeymoon !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: alexsar70
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel, great central location. Room was elegant and very comfortable. Best nights sleep I have had in years. Stayed here for my 40th birthday, received complimentary champagne and a room upgrade. Already saving up to stay here again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Peerless Service, Perfect Location, Sleek Elegance, But Boy Do You Pay For It!”
Reviews.Author: LunaLondon
Reviews.Content: Difficult to fault, other than for value for money. Service is exceptionally slick, personal and attentive - among the very best I have experienced. Views and balconies on Rue de la Paix and Place Vendome wonderful. Beds great, bathrooms quirky and indulgent, fittings very elegant and the whole place has a preternatural hush and calm. No pool, but a very nice spa and whirlpool. That said, the prices are so high that it is difficult to forget them and relax. Our suite was uber-expensive and swanky but the rooms still too small to really spread out and relax in; the sofa was a two-seater. Drinks start at E25 each in the bar and breakfast was E50. Easy to blow E120 on breakfast for two. God knows what it would come to if two had a blow-out dinner and got stinking drunk! Highly recommended for a special treat and/or on an almost unlimited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: zig123
Reviews.Content: This hotel sets the standard for Park Hyatts, and successfully caters to very discerning customers, with the tactful service standards of a true luxury hotel. I believe the PHP has carved a niche for itself among top Paris hotels for those seeking discreet but high level service. For instance, one can easily walk by the entrance without noticing the hotel, or walk in without feeling watched, a difficult feat in a Parisian palace. Due to the building's age and layout, there is a wide variety of rooms, even within a given category. All the rooms are furnished to the same high standards, with notably a walk-in dresser and luxurious open-plan bathroom, and have been recently fitted with LED-backlit Samsung TV's. The courtyard-facing rooms are quiet but somewhat dark, while some of the upper rooms on rue de la Paix have balconies with a place Vendome view. Breakfast and drinks at the hotel are expensive, but made from very good ingredients. For those interested, there is a Velib free bicycle rental station right across the street, and the Roissybus airport bus stop is only a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Fancy Pants”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: This place was ridiculously high end. Location is great and central for sightseeing. Service was unmatched, and staff was very nice. Rooms were very large especially by european standards. Only thing to watch is the room service and mini bar were insanely pricey. I ordered a coffee and it was 9 Euro. Dress Code: Most people we saw were wearing full suits and dresses at all hours of the day I sandals and a golf shirt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault one single thing in this hotel. We had a 2 night stay here. Very comfortable and quiet room overlooking inner courtyard. Spacious large bathroom. Great location with Champs Elysee, Louvre, Notre Dame areas all within walking distance. Staff attentive and always there without being intrusive. Very tranquil atmosphere in hotel. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: MaioDenmark
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay! Personel greeting at arrivel, complimentary champagne, strawberries and more at arrivel (speciel occation). Free upgrading to a deluxe room. Spacius, sitting area, perfect marble bathroom. Compared to lux hotels worldwide, we experienced the best service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for a free night as part of a Hyatt promotion and our stay started well with an upgrade to a deluxe queen room, at the front of the hotel, with views of the Rue de la Paix. The room looked recently renovated and was a reasonable size, with a separate dressing room, which was nice as the suitcases are kept out of the way. The wifi worked OK. The marble bathroom was quite small but with a big bath and separate shower and gold taps everywhere: however, the sliding door was quite heavy to move, especially from inside. We were surprised to find the mini bar was an automatic one which registered all items removed - didn't feel appropriate for a Park Hyatt. The public areas are also very smart, but the prices are eye-wateringly expensive - â‚¬12 for a small bottle of beer, â‚¬27 for a glass of Champagne in the bar. There are limited bar meals - â‚¬24 gets you five very small "mini cheeseburgers", which were very nice, but very small. We skipped breakfast at â‚¬48 each and went to find a cafe!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: sinbarambam
Reviews.Content: Last time in Paris we stayed at the George V and were not expecting too much of our stay at the Park Hyatt but it turned out to be of a similar level. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms spacious and very well-appointed, and the service very, very good. It's not quite perfect but it's close. I would highly recommend this hotel for either business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dws82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hyatt Vendome in August 2010 with my girlfriend. From the moment we arrived the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The location is brilliant and within walking distance of key attractions and shopping. Our room was on the small side (although think this is standard in Paris) and faced on to the internal courtyard. We didn't eat at the restaurants although would highly recommend the bar which serves amazing cocktails. Whilst its not cheap think the Prk Hyatt is a great city hotel with A grade service.

Reviews.Title: “From bad to good”
Reviews.Author: Vimino
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at room 341 on 12th Aug and thanks to Rosalie Guth and Gorka Bergareche in resolving the problem. This is our second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, elegant and modern”
Reviews.Author: IlGenio
Reviews.Content: We loved it. Not only the location is perfect if you want to visit the city but the hotel itself is a piece of art and should be visited, even just for a coffee in the lobby. It's rich but very modern at the same time. Beautiful bronze sculptures on the room's walls next to the lights. The decor (a lot of gold) is something special. If you have been to the Park Hyatt in Milan you'll see a lot of similarities (marble etc) but this hotel is more golden. Rooms (we were in a standard double) are spacious and the bathroom is monumental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rayenj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I travelled with my wife and two young children (ages 2 and 0). The hotel arranged a crib, some toys, special shampoo, kettle, etc. for the children. As mentioned in other reviews the location is great. Room is nice , clean and well sized. There was complimentary water and even the parking was complimentary. The Spa was great, but not for children. They don't allow children in the spa because of the heat, which is understandable. There is a big LCD Samsung TV with a blue ray player in the room. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Txtrav10
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome and was impressed at every detail of the hotel. As a very frequent Hyatt guest, I received an upgrade to the deluxe room category and was very pleased with the size of the room and bathroom. The room was very quiet and very nicely furnished. The bathroom was huge by Paris standards. The hotel is located just off Place de Vendome, around the corner from the Hotel Ritz. It is within walking distance to the Seine and the Batobus stop. Wonderful cafes, shopping and easy access to the Metro. A great place to stay! Ddesigner stores

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Ornate, First Class”
Reviews.Author: ramolnar
Reviews.Content: For tourism, the Park Hyatt Paris has a great location, near the Opera Metro stop, and within two blocks of Vendome. This makes it close to many other spots, like the Louvre and Champs Elysees. Short of being on the Seine, it would be tough to be better placed. Front desk and breakfast lounge service are very good, and thoughtful. Bellhop and concierge service is not too great in English, though. There are two daily maid services. The first brings out day pillows for the bed; the second puts them back. This is too much for me, but if you like high luxury this place is for you. The rooms are very ornate, like much of old Paris, but have been updated to modern heating, water, and so forth. It's not my personal style, but it does the job very well for what it wants to be. Breakfast food is generally spectacular - the brioche is on the short lists of best pastry I've ever had - but the scrambled eggs were underdone and runny. Just stick to the baked goods and you'll be happy, as I am with my overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: weiweidog
Reviews.Content: Pros: * The location of this hotel is terrific. It is close to shopping around Vendome as well as a 10 minute walk to the Louvre and the even the Musee d'Orsay. It is 2 blocks from the Opera House (which has a nice guided tour). We did walk to the Champs de Elysee which probably took 30 minutes but wouldnt recommend it. * The service levels are superb. We requested several items during our stay and they were promptly provided * As a diamond, breakfast was included and very good. The fresh fruit was terrific, and the selection of pastries were quite tasty. * Concierge service was good and they introduced us to a couple of good restaurants Cons: * We had a connecting park room. The view from the room was terrible (into a small skylight and several other rooms, and was rather small. We asked to have the rooms changed, but the hotel was near capacity and they were not able to locate another connecting room. The doors of the connections should be turned. the way they were located, the door was in the middle of a small room rather than flush against the wall. * The hallways smelled of the parfum, I didnt like it, but some might. Luckily, the smell did not go into our room. * The conditioner in the room was terrible. It did not seem to condition. We had to steal the shampoo from a friends room at the George V which did work well.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: naitsabes10
Reviews.Content: I always liked the Park Hyatt chain of hotels and the Park Hyatt Paris Vendome was no exception. As written by many before, the hotel is situated just prefectly within central Paris and the service is remarkable (try counting the number of hotel employees you get in touch with from entering the hotel to reaching the elevators). Our room was a bit small (still ok in Paris terms) but had a nice balcony to the inner courtyard and was nicely decorated. Services in the hotel is of course quite pricey (continental breakfast buffet is 42 Euro), but hey it's a 5-star property in Paris, after all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing view”
Reviews.Author: HarpendenManor
Reviews.Content: I travelled this summer with my friend with her 2 teenage daughters. We were allocated two rooms side-by-side. Despite my request of rooms with nice view, we were given back-side rooms overlooking other buildings windows. Check-in was smooth enough, and room was clean and spacious. The room amenity was bare minium with shampoos & soaps and slippers, but it did not have essential items such as shaver/razor or toothbrush. The room interior is very modern with dark brown carpet with two chairs, the table had a big wide mirror so while my friend was having a shower, I could use the table as a dresser. Although I did not use laptop, but there was a modem. Socket was easily reached as they were hidden neatly in the dresser table. Shower/bath floor was also modern fittings with beige marble tiles. Other than the poor view from the room, another downside of this hotel was that If you drink a bottled water it cost 8 euros in the room (6 euros in the public lounge on the ground floor). Moreover, there were very few chairs or sofas in a public lounge. If you want to sit down and rest after you checked out, you have to go to the cafe or restaurant on the ground floor. It was new and modern and trendy, but next time I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Accommodations - Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cqt
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay using points, reserving two rooms since we were taking our little one. Although we had to use two rooms worth of points, we were pleasantly surprised when we shown to our room. Basically, we were given two rooms that were connected with a salon in the middle. What a amazing surprise! In the past when we were told that we would be "pleasantly surprised" by the room that we were being given, the opposite was true because it invariably ends up that we got a tiny room. The reception's idea of a cruel joke - in fact, this happened at what is now the Westin Paris near the Tuilleries Gardens (was Intercontinental when I stayed there years ago). Not on this visit, though, so kudos to the Park Hyatt! The suite was amazing, starting with the salon which had a large flat panel TV, a dining area and living area. Instead of coffee makers, the salon had a Nespresso machine with different options for coffees, plus an electric tea kettle and traditional tea pot! Our master was very spacious with a proper king-sized bed. Our bathroom was out of this world large that wrapped AROUND the room. We loved the rainshower AND the heated toilet/bidet - what a fun way to sit on the throne! The second bedroom was large as well with two twin beds. The service at the Reception and Concierge was excellent! Everyone was helpful and friendly. For a hotel this size, I was pleasantly surprised by how personal the service was. With 3-4 concierges, I always felt like they knew what was planned for us once I gave them my name even over the phone because we were out and about. The one gripe I have about the hotel is the doormen. They were completely useless, especially the main doorman (bald fellow). I felt like he really picked and chose who he thought would tip him best when seeking to help folks. Getting a taxi was a trial because he never bothered to help - on one evening, it was so bad that a security detail actually went out to hail a taxi for us when he saw that I tried to do this. I did offer this feedback to the hotel via their survey and got a response back. What a poor representation of such a classy hotel. Other things to mention is that we had breakfast in bed - very tasty and no more than your standard hotel. We didn't try their restaurants. The location is pretty convenient because it's close to most of the tourist attractions like the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, etc. but it's a bit off the beaten track. It is class to nice shopping streets and some great shops (like Hermes!) - just a 10 minute walk. I don't think that I could stay anywhere else in Paris after staying here - it's really spoiled me for other hotels. On the next segment of our trip, we stayed at the Trianon Palace Versailles (a Waldorf-Astoria Collection hotel). Although it was nice, it was just such a letdown after the Park Hyatt. I will post that review shortly. One last thing - those creepy sculptures throughout the hotel are soooo creepy! Seriously, why?! It scared the s**t out of me when I had to use the bathroom in the middle of the night and they are everywhere in the hotel and rooms. Any light fixture and you're bound to see them - they look like melting mummies...

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, maybe not so chic guests”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night on the 5th of June for a quick break. I've spent a lot of time in Paris while I was a student many many years ago, so this trip was mainly for some shopping and relaxing in a good hotel. I think this hotel is quite nice with some minor gripes. I had a smallish room (for a 5*) with a big queen bed , but it had a quite nice dressing room and a good bathroom with a separate rain shower, a separate toilet and a bath. The room height is several meters, so it didn't feel too tiny after all. The inner courtyard was pretty and quiet. I was not too keen on the several Rodinesques "figures" in the room. Weirdly, the hotel does not have pay movies (you can go the the reception and choose a dvd from a folder). In general the service was impeccable with one exception, a young waitress in the lounge hardly looked at me while serving my afternoon champagne. No matter how much time I spend in France I never get used to this attitude.... Otherwise the lounge is really nice for a quick bite or a drink, it seemed to be frequented by elegant locals as well. Speaking of which I think the hotel should impose a dress code, I saw several persons walking around in the evening in shorts and sports shoes... Also, I found it annoying when some guets let their child run around in the lounge. I can't tell you much about the food, I'm a vegetarian and I have to say that what was on offer was not much and not very impressing (pasta with tomato sauce, anyone?). I tasted a couple of different wines, they were quite good. The breakfast was included in my rate, so I had the buffet. It's ok, but nothing spectacular, loved the compote, tough. Three things I'd like to suggest for development: a better assortment of cheese (it's France after all!), the little baguettes are cute, but very hard, and it would be much more hygienic if the utensils on the buffet table had little plates where you put them instead of putting them in the bowls. All in all, there are some minor issues for development, but I liked the style of the hotel and of course the location, and I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennykp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Hyatt Vendome in Paris and i found it to be fantastic. I had let the hotel know in advance that i was travelling with a baby (this was our first time away with our 4 month baby) and they went above and beyond in accomadating us. We arrived at 11.00am and check-in was not until 3.00pm, however the lady at reception got us a spa room to change and feed our baby. When we returned from our lunch at 1.00pm our room was ready and they had very kindly upgraded our room. We were taken to our room where we found a baby cot ready made up with a baby changing area set up, a baby bath with baby toiletries and a bottle /food warmer ready. I cannot begin to explain how helpful all of this was for us. On one of the mornings, the concierge tried to help me find a good bakery and phoned around to makesure they were open and advised me of quite a few very nice places to eat. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and had all the facilities that one could want. I found only one fault during my whole stay there and that was when i was leaving, i asked a porter for help and he asked me to wait a moment as he was about to do something, but never came back. Despite this very mall fault, i would definately go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location but Rooms are sub Park Hyatt standard”
Reviews.Author: centuriontraveller3
Reviews.Content: We're regular Paris goers but this was our first stay at the Park Hyatt Vendome. Check-in was terrible, since they messed up our booking. When they finally managed to retrieve it, they escorted us to a room with a queen size bed - not the room type we had booked. After we complained, they allocated us a different room. Rooms are ok, but as regular Park Hyatt guests, we were dis-appointed with the fittings. The public areas of the hotel are very stylish, but the rooms clearly tell that this property is a Hyatt convert rather than a new development.

Reviews.Title: “Great Tulieres Location”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This is in the best location of all Marriott run Paris hotels in my opinion. The best Paris boutiques - not the large, now international stores - are found right here, pure Heaven! The property is on a little side street very close to the Tulieres metro stop, which I took from CDG International for E8 without difficulty, thanks to an email from the hotel telling me directions. It is a very short walk from the lovely park & Louvre, near Notre Dam. It is quiet & very elegant inside. Our room request was for a twin but I checked in early (they were great) & the room available for myself & my daughter was a king. I came back later & they had converted it to a twin - very thoughtful. The room was distinct in that it had a shower/tub & sink in one part of the room & another sink & toilet in a different part - very European. The style was French modern - elegant. Our room was very plush & comfortable, overlooking an attractive interior courtyard. Room service breakfast was delicious & not outrageous. Excellent coffee & pastries. I will be returning to this hotel for its great location, elegant feel & competent employees. I did not particularly have much interaction with any one employee there, but was treated throughout my stay in a polite & welcoming way.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jeff800
Reviews.Content: First, the bad. We reserved a King Park Suite. The first room we were shown was nothing like the room pictured on the web. It was small, cramped with a slopping ceiling over the bed. Horrible. When we rejected that room, we were shown to a room just like we had reserved. A hotel of this caliber should not try something like this. Once we got the right room, the hotel couldn't be better. Perfect location, excellent room with a guest bathroom and separate dressing area with drawers and hanging space galore. Excellent service, without being overly intrusive. Would return without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SGER
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights from 5/25-5/29. Upgraded to a King suite---huge room, two bathrooms, great bed, huge HD Samsung LCD, very quiet. Great bar and restaurant. Very helpful staff (used the Hyatt staff for French Open tickets). Best location in Paris. Have stayed at both the Four Seasons George V and Le Bristol in the past three years and the Park Hyatt is superior to both.

Reviews.Title: “Extremy expensive, but nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Bateman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located. The service is awesome. And the rooms incredible. And they even have free valet parking. Really nothing bad to say about it, except their prices: 25 Euro a cocktail, 14 Euro a small beer and 42 euro for breakfast is way too much, even for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - One of the best city centre Hyatts in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Boycey0ycey01
