Reviews.Content: Enjoyed two days and one night at the Park Hyatt as a Diamond member, I have seen a few.... An excellent hotel with great staff, fantastic rooms and overall a luxurious feel. The style (lavish gold fixtures and fittings with gold painted wall features) may not appeal to everyone (especially the minimalist!) however the design, mixed in with the bronze cast wall statues just works! The SPA area, Jacuzzi, steam and sauna were empty during the day - it felt like my own place for a couple of hours. Whilst on the smallish side, the SPA is a great experience. Obviously Place Vendome is THE address, however compared to the Ritz, the Hyatt has a more accessible and cool feel. The staff are knowledgeable and attentive, especially the door staff and front of house. If there was any downside experienced, it was the staff at breakfast. who seemed disjointed and slightly stressed. Will definitely use this as my base for future Paris visits.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DominicBathEngland
Reviews.Content: An incredibly modern,spacious hotel lurks behind a classical facade steps away from the Ritz .It is wonderful to be able to stroll to the Louvre or Rue St Honore stuffed with lovely shops.There are no more taxis in Paris now than in 1935 so position is everything. Staff were utterly charming.Rooms are calm but not large.They are utterly comfortable and my bathroom was small but brilliantly designed. Public spaces are large and the restaurant whilst not cheap served up high quality French food albeit in petite portions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel/exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: PHFlorida
Reviews.Content: I, like many others who have posted comments, used Hyatt points ( 20,000 per night) for our room. All recent comments are accurate and not exaggerated: classy, sophisticated hotel with impeccable attention to customer service. The gratis wine and chocolates were an exceptional touch.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Killa_and_Todd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went Paris on a last minute decision to join some friends for fashion week. We booked the week before leaving and were delighted to find availability to book on points. It was my husband first time in Europe and we had just gotten engaged. We wanted to make it something to remember. The hotel is classical and on the conservative side and the decor is a little cold. The service was impeccable, as usual at the Hyatt. After reading the reviews, we asked for a room looking over the inner court. We got a room on the top floor and we were extremely pleased with our room. We had three windows looking over the courtyard with flower baskets hanging from the windows. The room was very comfortable, the decor in the room was warm and luxurious. We had a very nice bathroom with shower and bath. The heated towel rack pleased my husband very much. We had several surprises in our room. The complementary bottles of Evian where very welcome (specially since they are 18 euros for 500ml on the room service menu). A half bottle of wine was there one night when we returned to the room and a box of chocolates another night. I am not sure if my husband had asked for special treatment since we had just recently gotten engaged. Nevertheless, I was very impressed. The concierge did all the arrangements for us with exactitude. They even gave us a little note with the address and phone number of the restaurants before we left in case we got lost of were late. The hotel has a prime location, with many flagship stores located on the same street. The opera is down the street and the Cafe de la Paix as well. Our friend was staying at the Ritz and was envious of our hotel. I don't know if the hotel is good value since we stayed on points. However, if your budget allows you to stay there, please do. It was an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: AlphaFlyer
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a Platinum member of Starwood's loyalty program, but my stay at this one hotel was so wonderful that I am seriously considering making a wholesale switch to Hyatt. I spent four nights here recently, and originally booked this particular hotel because I simply wanted a nice, hassle and mishap-free stay. It turned out to actually be a highlight of our trip. This Park Hyatt has the nicest, most helpful, and most resourceful staff of probably any hotel in which I've ever stayed. When we checked in, our room wasn't ready and the front desk staff comped us a bottle of water while we waited probably no more than 5 minutes. It was a small token, I know, but still much appreciated. The concierge cheerily booked us dinner reservations at local restaurants on a regular basis because of our poor French. Also, on our last day a bottle of wine mysteriously showed up in our room. I'm not sure if this was because the staff had seen a few empty ones in our room over the course of the stay, or if this was the doing of the concierge staff (one of which asked for my room number for no reason I could discern at the time), but however it happened, it was a wonderful touch. As for the room, it was fantastic. The huge bathrooms are certainly anomalous among Parisian hotels, and the sink within the shower was extremely neat and surprisingly useful. The service staff are very vigilant about maintaining the room in the mornings and afternoon turn-down. My only very minor bone to pick is that the ice bucket in the room is so small that you cannot fit both the ice and a bottle of wine in it at the same time. I had to crush our ice in the sink and scoop it into the ice bucket around the bottle. Perhaps they have separate ice buckets specifically for bottles of wine, but I would have felt like a bit of an idiot calling down to ask that question. That said, I wouldn't have been surprised if they'd miraculously appeared with a larger ice bucket had I asked. To top it all off, I was extremely happy that in spite of booking this stay as an award using Hyatt points, we were treated as well as we were. Considering the average nightly rate here, I half-expected to be treated as a second-class citizen. Yet the front-desk staff didn't bat an eye when the check-in card showed a blank line-item for the nightly rate or when our grand total for four nights came to a whopping 19 euro. Hyatt, if you're reading this, thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: Kenny_PHD
Reviews.Content: What to say, I have been in this hotel only for a 2 nights stay and I can describe my experience as fantastic. Atmosphere, service, the rooms and public areas were absolutely 5 star. This, in a very central location so that I had the chance to both work and enjoy paris life. I will be back soon. Kenny

Reviews.Title: “Great European Hotel with First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent travelers, and we appreciate luxury hotels. We're diamond Hyatt members and decided on our stay at the Park Hyatt. There is no Diamond Club Room, but they do offer complimentary Breakfast for Diamond members. This hotel is one of the most luxurious for European standards. Service = A+ Park Hyatt Vendome has won numerous awards for superior service, and rightly so. The staff speaks perfect English and did not appear insulted when we tried to use some French. They were very patient and helpful. Ask the Concierge for recommendations on where to go for Dinner and Sight-seeing. Our Concierge recommended "Rue du Cler", a little, non-tourist 2-block road with the cutest little shops and side cafes. Go to the Olive Oil store, and try their 12 year old balsamic vinegar that tastes like a delicious port wine. Fitness/Spa = B+ The Fitness center has state-of-art equipment. But, it's very small. 2 treadmills, 1 bike, and 1 eliptical. They supply water, headphones, TV, and apples. All equipment's in excellent condition, but very small. However, Paris real estate is in high demand, so I didn't expect it to be large. Spa is also very nice. Comfortable surroundings with jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna. Rooms = B+ The room size is great. We had ours facing the away from the noise, and can see the tops of the Eiffel Tower and Opera House. Rooms are very clean and new. Not as Modern as many has said - the designs seem more based on Rodin's Bronze sculptures. I only gave B+, because there were a few things I would change about the room. One is the ceiling. Some of the ceiling areas were sloped - so we hit ourselves on the ceiling a few times. The shower was also not very hot. We turned it all the way to 50 celcius, but it was still just lukewarm. The showers in the Spa room were at the right temperature Breakfast = A The food is pretty basic: fruit, cereal, bread, salmon, cheese, danishes. You can order eggs on the side. My husband had the eggs benedict, and I had an egg-white omelet with salmon. They were the best we ever had. Eggs included fresh herbs, which made all the difference. Breakfast is all about service. You get the best Illy coffee, and the eggs made on request. But, it takes a very long time to make the eggs. Expect to relax and spend about 1 hour on breakfast. Breakfast costs about $50 Euros a person. Location = A+ Walking distance to the Louvre, Musee d' Orsay and the shopping centers around the Opera House. Conveniently located to several Metro stations. There's a bus that takes you directly to Charles de Gaulle airport in 30 mins for about $10 Euros. All-in-all, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: katdSurrey
Reviews.Content: A glorious place to stay. The staff were the most attentive I have ever experienced in a hotel, amazing attentive quality of the service. Luxurious rooms, large comfortable beds, and divine robes and towels.The spa although small is a lovely place to relax, with tea and water laid on. Lovely touches of chocolate in your room to greet you, bottles of water by your bed at night and lovely bathroom shampoo and body lotions etc. I could not fault this hotel and highly recommend it. Brilliant central location r=too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, classy 5 star hotel by a picky reviewer”
Reviews.Author: SFjoe
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this Park Hyatt and in spite of Fashion Week in Paris we got a lovely room and that was spacious and tastefully done. The service was not at all snobby and super friendly for such an upscale property. The hotel was filled with famous models and hanger-on's but the hotel never ignored us because we were not part of any famous party staying at the hotel. I intend to return to this hotel on my next stay. One of the best hotel stays in Paris. Loved it. Great location and comfortable room. Zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ulka35
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Paris is still 2 weeks away but the Vendome has already made a great impression on my husband and me. We have planned a week in Paris using free Hyatt award nights and needed to arrange for a 3rd family member to stay with us. We contacted the hotel directly with a request for an additional bed. We received a response the next day offering to upgrade our room to a larger one and ensuring everything would be ready for our arrival per our request. The hotel manager was extremely polite and welcoming! We canâ€™t wait to spend our vacation there.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location...”
Reviews.Author: Armorstud
Reviews.Content: If you are used to the United States living conditions and standards, this hotel is for you. It is a newer hotel with the space of US hotels for the rooms. Great Concierges and the bar/lounge is great. Just be prepared because everthing is $$$$. The location is great. It is near tons of sites and food places. I love the decor with the modern look.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: SBawa
Reviews.Content: Nice location Very Nice view outside Close to shopping Little small concierge but still helpful Good Restaurant

Reviews.Title: “First Class in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: ESAC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 5 nights on our honeymoon and could not have asked for a better experience. The location is excellent - close to all the attractions and two metro stops. The rooms are comfortable, spacious, and spotless. (I think this is the first time I stayed in a hotel where I did not find a hair in the room - and I travel a lot!) Every member of the staff was helpful and friendly and very personable. We left for two days to go to Belgium and upon checking in our second stay the front desk person asked how our trip to Belgium was. I'll also mention that I accidentally left the safe open one day while we were out -- the housekeeper cleaned the room while we were gone and not a thing was touched. Of course all of this luxury does come at a price, but if you want to indulge this is a great place to do it!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home ...”
Reviews.Author: EnigmaWmn
Reviews.Content: In 2006, when our #1 choice, Le Meurice, was sold out because we switched our NYE plans to Paris rather late, we decided to give Park Hyatt a try. Never having stayed at a Hyatt before, and being rather skeptical of the property, we turned out to be, like the title suggests, pleasantly surprised.â€¨â€¨ Exclusively located no more than 100 meters away from Place Vendome Park Hyatt is a modern hideaway designed by Aman's Ed Tuttle. Full of art & signature sculptures, some good and some very bad, the atmosphere is quiet & stylish, despite the lobby & bar always being full with people.â€¨â€¨ Rooms are large (Park Suite King & Jr. Suite, facing rue de la Paix with excellent views on Place Vendome), with floor to ceiling windows. Lots of mirrors and sculptural detail. Bathrooms are also large, with heated floors and rain shower. Amenities are all by Blaise Mautin, whose signature scent permeates the hotel and people usually walk away loving it or hating it.â€¨â€¨ Since our initial stay in 2006 we have visited three more times. A week in 2007 during NYE & few more nights in June of 2009, when hotel was fully booked due to Roland Garros final, but that has not in any way affected service, which has been timely & excellent. Our most recent 5 night stay was for 2010 NYE celebration.â€¨â€¨ Staff is young & fluent in English. Very helpful & pleasant to deal with & no complaints whatsoever.â€¨â€¨ Aesthetically, a very appealing hotel and now our home-base in Paris, despite previously giving preference to Le Meurice, Costes & Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: CedricΠerre
Reviews.Content: I have few things to add, all has already been said in the numerous reviews. Location of Park Hyatt VendÃ´me is excellent, close to the Jardin des Tuileries & The Louvres, right accross the Place VendÃ´me and a few minutes walk from OpÃ©ra and famous department stores like Galeries Lafayette & Printemps. We had booked a Park Suite and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Suite Park Executive, consisting of two rooms => bedroom & sitting room with two full bathrooms. The suite was very nice, but if you're a light sleeper you shall request a room facing the inner courtyards and not the Rue de la Paix in order to avoid traffic noise. I read some reviews stating that furniture & carpets were tired, this is not the case, don't worry. The only negative point would be the TV (old B&O) which should be changed for larger flat screens. Service is excellent, but not comparable to the George V. Breakfast is fantastic, and all public areas are beautiful. Overall Park Hyatt is a very good choice, when you like modern and luxury in a different way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ebennike
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris many times, but this hotel is definitely the best, I have ever stayed at there. We were fortunate enough to be able to stay for three award nights. The hotel would normally be more expensive than what I am usually prepared to pay. However, there is a reason for the high price. For a start, the location of the hotel is just fantastic, on Rue de la Paix mid-way between Place VendÃ´me and the OpÃ©ra, you are pretty much close to almost everything. That was great. Furthermore, the standard of the quality was great, rooms are (for Parisian standards) relatively spacious, large beds, walk-in closet and a great shower with separate shower, bath and toilet. The rooms hold designer B&O-televisions (although a bit small for today's standards), dvd-player and complimentary Evian water. Staff was awesome, spoke a good English (of course with a charming French accent) and were extremely helpful and friendly and not in the "give-me-some-tips"-imposing kind of way. Absolutely perfect, and probably the best staff I have met at any hotel around the world. The spa is a nice feature of the hotel with a small fitness centre, which feels nice to use in spite of its size, a large jacuzzi (for both men and women, so remember to bring swim suits), steam bath and sauna. I pretty much had it all to myself, which was also pretty nice. Massages and other treatments were also available, but at a pretty high cost (160â‚¬ for a 1 hour massage). The same also goes for the prices of restaurants and mini bars. A bottle of coke from the mini bar would set you back by 12â‚¬. That is ridiculous. It is ok to charge high prices for the mini bar, but 12â‚¬ for a coke, that's just out of this world. The restaurant, which by the way as far as I know holds a star in the Michelin guide, was also very pricy, and (full) breakfast costs 48â‚¬ per person! With so many other nice options for breakfast just around the corner, we decided to skip this. I was told that it is indeed very nice, but again - it better be for 48â‚¬. Apart from the price level, the only thing missing here are the views. Most rooms will not have a view of anything but a tiny courtyard. Maybe a swimming pool would also be nice for a hotel of this standard. All in all - I warmly recommend this hotel to anybody able to spend bonus points here or travelling on an expense account. For the rest of us, it is something that we have to save up for, but for a special event or just a real treat for a weekend or so - you will definitely not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “faultless”
Reviews.Author: doudacairo
Reviews.Content: very well apointed hotel for business and leisure..location is perfect . very well manged only tried room service which was very good with good suggestions from the one took my order apon arrival greeted by cristina duty manager which was a nice touch the concierges are very helpful and courteous for what i asked for

Reviews.Title: “f i could describe it in one word - outstanding warmth. Most amazing dream break we could have wished for”
Reviews.Author: TrippingOnEarth
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed there for a two night break on the occasion of our wedding anniversary. The hotel is located in the best area of Paris if you want to be a stone away from all major cultural venues. The premise is a dream in itself... If i could describe it in one word - outstanding warmth. From the amazing scent floating 24/7 (had to buy a spray home; -P ) to the warm tones of the interior design, and amazing room with more amazing bathroom cloud like bed and balcony giving on the place vendome, to the exquisite breakfast passing to the wonderful attentive and warm staff (ok..you are paying quiet a lot of money but still..some luxury hotels can give you an unpersonal feeling..) Most of all the Concierge staff is the most amazing helpful laidback in a professional manner, giving impressive attentive service and warm hospitality. The hotel doesnt come cheap but I it is worth every single euro. It was difficult to get back home :) can't wait for an occasion to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: solohobo
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris in December and rented a apartment then flew to Morocco for two weeks and had a one night layover in Paris from Marrekech before heading back to Chicago, and I earned a free night stay at a Hyatt during a promotion in the USA from thru Dec15. I could not believe they allowed my to book my reward at a luxury property, but what a treat. Our Apt we rented was on the opposite bank nearer the Pompidou which we love that area a lot. I have been to Paris many times over the years and have stayed all over the city. I travel 4 star in EU and USA for work, but for leisure this would not be my choice for my both my style and the euro/usd, unlike going to the Mandarin in Bangkok is a value if you know what I mean. This is a lovely serene and luxurious property that has no faults in any manner. Its beautiful, the rooms are cozy, well appointed, very quiet, and the bathrooms are fantastic, my wife took 3 baths in 2 days :), But after Morocco you would too, as were backpacking in the desert...haha Not sure if anyone booking this hotel would even check trip advisor as the this level hotel goes without saying its a gem, and being on the Vendome next to the Ritz, as well as the Opera, its just magical. Its snowed while were there, and this area is so Parisian and sophisticated, its just perfect. If you want to enjoy a cozy and classic french cuisine, head to Le Coup Chou. Also the Steak Tar Tar at Le Colbert is the best I have had in my life, and spend 8 months a year entertaining for business from NY to Milan.. The only problem with a property like this, is the prices of everything in Euro is hard to fathom, as breakfast was 40 Euro a head...$60 USD PP for a buffet...YIKES!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute class!”
Reviews.Author: chrisadi
Reviews.Content: A very nice and luxury room to stay. the bathroom was incredibly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Gay Paree!”
Reviews.Author: TracyWilliams1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very sophisticated charm geared to dazzle the sense with art.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (much better on expenses!)”
Reviews.Author: TandVP
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night for a business meeting at the hotel. The location is one of the best for sights, exclusive shopping and transport links. The staff very good and as you would expect from the Park Hyatt brand. The meeting rooms are well equipped. We only ate lunch at the hotel and it was well presented and very good quality. The bar is good with a few different areas to sit with lounge atmosphere and log fire to a heated, outdoor patio section. I had the standard room while some colleagues had various larger rooms and suites. The rooms are modern and comfortable, not huge bedroom areas, but the wet area is substantial. I thought the hotel was starting to look a bit tired around the edges and the look is now a bit dated imho. In all, this is a very good hotel, but I am not sure I can tell you this offers great value for money. The standard room was over â‚¬500 (book with AMEX to get breakfast thrown in). I struggle to work out how to justify that kind of expense for what I got. I think they need to review the WiFi / Internet policy which is only free in the business area. But if you want to splurge then this is a good place to start.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and beautiful outdoor terrace”
Reviews.Author: tonyonholiday
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt has the best location close to the shopping area around Opera and the gorgeous Place Vendome and all its high-end jewelry shops. It is also a short stroll from the Tuileries gardens which even in the fall remain a great walk on a sunny day. The hotel itself is truly luxurious and trendy, the breakfast/lounge area is in a beautiful glass covered interior courtyard and they have an outdoor terrace where you can smoke cigars and indulge in one of the many innovative cocktails (try the pimento Mohito!). Great place to relax but also do business meetings and enjoy Paris in style.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Park Hyatt Paris”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: My choices for this trip was between Ritz-Carlton and Park Hyatt Vandome. We're glad we chose Park Hyatt, which is just around the corner to Ritz-Carlton Paris. This was a quick Paris weekend getaway for three nights. We chose this property for its location and after reading rave reviews on Tripadvisor. Our room was very modern, spacious with a balcony facing Rue de la Paix, yet surprising quiet at night. Upon checking in, we were pampered and cared for in every detail. The concierge made all the arrangements for us, including dinner reservations. The staff at the hotel restaurant were helpful, friendly and unpretentious. We did not use the spa or the fitness room during our stay because after breakfast every morning we were out and about exploring the City. Breakfast buffet for the two of us at the hotel restaurant costs 98 Euros daily. Not cheap, but beats ordering a la carte, when a cup of coffee costs 9 Euros, and Eggs Benedict costs 24 Euros. Luckily we had daily breakfast buffet included with our room rate, which made it worthwhile. As other reviews mentioned, the television was the drawback of the stay - it is small, balky, with limited channels in English. The special fragrance in the lobby and hallways was subtle and more noticeable in the public areas than in our room. Few of the really good restaurants other than the restaurant in the hotel that we liked within walking distance are: La Tute, Cafe de la Paix, Leon De Bruxelles (All you can eat mussels cooked to order on Sunday evenings), and Fauchon for great take out sandwiches, foie gras and macrarons.

Reviews.Title: “Award Stay Won't Make You Different”
Reviews.Author: dorisirene
Reviews.Content: I would love to share my experience with those who want to book an award stay, even I have yet stay at PH Vendome. Some comments and reviews at travel forums mentioned that award stays were not as lovely as paid stays. This may not apply to every situation. My sister and I used to be loyal customers of Hyatt, enjoyed staying at PH Sydney, HR Waikiki, GH Bali, HR London and GH Tokyo. We left Goldpassport for Starwood Preferred Guest few years ago because SPG has a more widespread of hotels and offers more attractive rate than Hyatt. Therefore, we decided to clear all our points during our visit to Paris in coming December, quit our priority on Westin and Srcibe. My sister was rather nervous and stressed while arranging our room reservation, for a dreadful experience in booking with Goldpassport points in the past. To avoid explaining and clarifying our reservations again and again upon arrival, especially after tiring flight, my sister thus contacted the hotel to make sure our reservations are all being well-organised since we have got few separate award reservations for entire stay. What's beyond our expectation, staff is very responsive to all her enquires in a professional manner, giving us an impression on their attentive service and warm hospitality. Special thanks to Pascal at the France Reservation Centre, for his prompt and kind assistance. Prior to our stay, we have already feel welcomed and strongly believe our stay would be memorable and wonderful. It won't be too early or subjective to say 'all treated the same, no matter for award or paid stay'.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 50th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler16Ny
Reviews.Content: I just returnes from a 5 day stay at the Park Hyatt. It was a surprise 50th for my wife and we couldn't have been happier. The service was outstanding, the room, a deluxe king, was spacious and perfect and the location could not have been better. The concierge was outstanding arranging tranporation and dinners for us. He even found us a pub in Paris that had the NFL games on for me. I would highly reccomend this property.

Reviews.Title: “severely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: norm5Seattle
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from this hotel since it is a Park Hyatt. The rooms for such an expensive hotel are very average at best and not comparable to other hotels in Paris of the same caliber. In size the room we had was very small and had little in the way of decor other than the morbid dead body statues that you see throughout the hotel. The bathroom was its saving grace with good quality toiletries and a nice bathtub combination with shower. I would also praise the concierge at the hotel for recommending local restaurants, one of which was a wonderful Italian restaurant named Barlotti's. The hotel restaurant's breakfast is so overpriced that we ate out at a bakery each morning. The price should be less than half of what it was asking for. The hotel is in a good location, but compare it price and quality wise to the Paris Hilton Arc de Triomphe and you will see a huge difference as the Hilton is significantly better. Love Hyatts generally, but the last two experiences, the Park Hyatt, and the Grand Hyatt on Kauai, were less than wonderful. Hyatt needs to look at its price structure for some of its properties, particularly its restaurants which are not competitive.

Reviews.Title: “I love love love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelAndSherw
Reviews.Content: Right from the start we had great service at this hotel. When we checked in not only did we get a room upgrade for free, but also the nice gentleman who checked us in even showed us to our room and explained how everything worked in the room and what services were available at the hotel. The room was beautiful and big. The location was also great. I will definitely return to the Park Hyatt Vendome for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time recently as one of the winners of a free Hyatt night from their recent online sweepstakes (yes, it was real and real people sometimes win!). I arrived here early and was hoping to get checked in before noon but as the hotel was sold out the previous night could not (who says there's a recesssion in Paris???). Marc, the front desk person was very friendly and helpful and even was nice enough to lie to me that my French was good (don't ask my French friends that!!). As my room wasn't ready yet, he prepared my paperwork and took my luggage for me then asked if he could call me when the room was ready (unfortunately I didn't have cell service in France). When I returned several hours later (after a nice walk around the area), Marc took me directly to my room where my luggage had already been taken and showed me around the room. He pointed out the recent changes to the hotel and even mentioned that they were planning on doing some upgrades soon (yes, the flat screens are coming soon for those who are looking for them). The room, although not as spacious as the last time I was there was still very nice with a great bathroom (rain shower head and soaking tub) and a nice walk-in closet (almost as big as some hotel rooms in NYC!). The spa was nice----while I didn't take any treatments, I used the exercise room and co-ed sauna/whirlpool and was pleased. Only issue I had was that the attendant came in at 10pm to kick me out even though it said they were open until 11pm. Oh well, that's the French for you! Didn't try the restaurant but it looked good (pricey, but it's a hotel restaurant). Location is great especially if you want to see the Louvre. I met a guy in the exercise room who was there on his anniversary and he said that he had stayed earlier at the Westin down the street. While he said they had better views (they could see the Eiffel Tower), he said that the Park Hyatt was a hundred times better due to the service. What better endorsement could you get than that. Definitely love this hotel and would love to stay here again-----on someone else's dime though! :)

Reviews.Title: “A Warm Cocoon”
Reviews.Author: acchi
Reviews.Content: Good staff, food, security, concierge, rooms and bed, especially the bath tub. A flat screen for next time please! I would go back any time. Thank you Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: katiedblaze
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip through France and I had to write a review of this hotel. Even before we arrived I was impressed with the prompt and thorough responses from the Concierge Desk. Upon our arrival; tired from an overnight flight from Miami, we were greeted with complete professionalism and attention to detail. Our room was spacious with a full sized bathroom that had separate his/her sections and a full bathtub. The breakfast buffet had a wide selection of fruit, cereals, yogurt, cheeses and smoked salmon (delicious!) as well as many hot choices and a la carte options. My husband loved the pancakes and waffles. The coffee was wonderful and the fresh squeezed orange juice had me adding oj to my morning routine. Who knew oj could taste so good? (and I am from Florida). The staff at breakfast were particularly friendly and helpful with any questions we had about our activities for the day. The location of the hotel was also excellent - close to shopping, major attractions (a quick stroll to the Louvre, Tuilleries, Champs Elysees, and Notre Dame) as well as 2 metro stations (Tuilleries and Madeleine). I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlieFolsom
Reviews.Content: We just returned and loved the Park Hyatt facility but we loved the Hyatt staff even more. Forget the comments about the French being rude. The Hyatt staff went out of their way to provide service and assistance. A great hotel, in a great location with a dedicated staff. Recommendations are: they should provide free internet (i think it was $19 euros per day...ouch!) and the TV's in our room was older, not a wide screen and poor resolution making it difficult to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, central location, and world class shopping”
Reviews.Author: pranzieri
Reviews.Content: This is a maticulous maintained hotel in central Paris near the opera house. Very close to the subway and many of Paris' main attractions. The room was surprising large and furnished with high end amenities. The staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make your stay special. The restaurant and lounge were very good and had a chic appearance. The only downside was that the dinning/lounge was a little pricey, but still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: talperry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and had a great experience! The hotel is located near the ritzy Vendome Place and walking distance to the Opera, Madeleine Place, and great shopping destinations. The rooms are immaculate with highest amenities and are very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: rachda
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 4 days , and we had the best time . the location is perfect (5 min' from metro - opera station) ,and the staff is very very nice to you , especially when you arrive . no need to spend alot of money on the expensive rooms, we stayed at the park queen room and we loved it ! ! for a young couple that's more then enough . you can also bring your mp3 player and listen to it with the TV speakers . ** the only bad thing i can tell u about this hotel is - do not make any phone calls from the room , it's very expensive !!!! hope you will enjoy it as much as i did :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional -- artist style and graceful staff”
Reviews.Author: JD #25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful location just off Place Vendome and near luxurious shops and historic sites. The hotel is gorgeous and reflects many fine elements that were as much artistic as elegant. The staff is polished, attentive, and delightfully pleasant in every way. The accommodations are superb as are the restaurants. And, the spa is luxurious with a talented staff who know their work as true professionals. Can't say enough about this superb hotel and I consider myself to be a tough grader.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get Any Better"”
Reviews.Author: ExpTraveller50
Reviews.Content: I would doubt anyone needs validation that this is one of the best hotels anywhere. Great location, amazing staff, upscale decor, all the amenities. If you can afford it (or have the points), by all means stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BFLOMAN
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets better each time I visit. While I am sure the other great hotels in Paris receive better reviews (Four Season, Ritz, Crillon, etc) this hotel holds it's own with the best of Paris. Location is great. Very trendy modern feel to the hotel. Rooms are wonderful Food is good (lunch only) Great Soap!!! (you will know what I mean if you stay here) Made just for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel; Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: JMK-Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Our family just spent four nights at the Park Hyatt in three separate rooms. Overall, I agree with the majority of the other reviews re the hotel, its location, etc. For the rates that they charge, however, we expected better service. On the plus side, the concierge desk was very knowlegeable and helpful. The people at the reception desk were also very good. It seemed like everyone spoke perfect English. We had a minor problem with the turn-down service. Two nights out of four they neglected to leave us ice in the room. One night they brought it up after we called. The other night they said it was too late to get ice (approximatelly 11:00 p,m) because housekeeping was gone for the day. For a hotel charging more than $1,000/night per room, I found this response to be unacceptable. The bigger problem was the bed configuration for the room that our children were staying in. When we arrived, they told us that they could convert the king bed (2 twins pushed together) in to two separate, stand-alone beds. Depite four phone calls over three days, they never converted the king bed. I finally gave up. Based on our experience, I wouldn't recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “modern, discreet elegance”
Reviews.Author: malaLondra
Reviews.Content: as and above expectations. definetely one of the best choices for a 5* hotel in paris

Reviews.Title: “Calm and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kannm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in June in a Park Executive Suite. The second you walk into the hotel you can feel the calm. It is not ornate, like the Ritz, but it has a completely different zen feel. It may not be for everyone, but I loved the signature scent of the hotel and actually bought the perfume! I loved the decor. Room service was wonderful. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the restaurant - I found it to be very average. I think the hotel provides value given the price point. I will stay there again the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but at what price?”
Reviews.Author: coconutcrab
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel - beautifully designed, elegant, very comfortable. But is it really worth the money? Not really I'm afraid. You can get so much more for your money in Hyatts in other cities, so save your cash for them and stay somewhere cheaper. And extras are definitely *not* included: 8 euros for water? 12 euros to use wifi? 48 euros for breakfast?

Reviews.Title: “What is there not to love about Hyatt?”
Reviews.Author: im70schild
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at Hyatt Vendome in an executive suite on points. What a great hotel! The executive suite was out of this world with two full bathrooms. And the staff were so accommodating. There was a great assortment available for their continental breakfast, and we ordered eggs and omelets, they were fantastic. I now know how the rich and famous live.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: RonBruins
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Park Hyatt Vendome in beginning of May. You easily can get spoiled after staying in this hotel. It starts with the arrival at the airport, they wait for you at the departure of the plane, right at the gate and will be guided to the car which (of course) is parked very close to the terminal. We were traveling with an 6 months old baby and the car was equipped with a carseat for this. At the arrival we were welcomed by the staff and after checkin we were guided to our room. Also for our baby everyhting was arranged. The restaurant makes food (mashed) on demand. In the room they added plenty of ammenities for the baby, like a bathtub, bottle heater, babycot, toys, etc. The food and drinks are somewhat expensive, but what do you expect in a hotel like this. We had dinner in the restaurant (1 michelin star) and the food was great and of course the servive here again wonderful as well. The rooms are very nice and spacious for paris standards and the hotel is located in a beautiful area of paris, close to place vendome, champs elysee and the louvre. The area is filled with shops and very close to the main Chanel Store at Rue Cambon, were of course my wife like to spent a few days :) Overall a great stay, great staff and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Elegant. Phenominal”
Reviews.Author: Mskellydoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed here also on Hyatt points. I wanted to spend the day at the Lourve and this was in very close proximity. The hotel is the definition of boutique elegance however if you are paying out of pocket, very pricy. The bathroom was amazing, giant tub, sink in the shower.. It was amazing. The decor is very modern and chic without being obnoxious.The restaurant downstairs in the open air lobby area was nice although a glass of wine and bowl of pasta was 42 euro. The staff were amazing to me, loved this place. Would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not really worth the price”
Reviews.Author: JSPrima
Reviews.Content: Overall - this is a nice hotel - beautiful decor, knowledgeable staff and excellent location. While my room was small, the bathroom was very large. Shower was an amazing set up. My recommendation is that if you like your room to be a bit quieter, request the room on the side facing the street, rather than interior courtyard. The outside courtyard is open at least to 1 AM and you can easily hear the guests. So, while the hotel was nice, I'm not really sure it was worth the price - around $750 a night. For that price - I really was expecting this amazing room (decent size, new technologies, spotless, etc)- and that wasn't the case. Luckily - since I had Hyatt points - a couple of my nights were free. If I went back, I'd need to be subsidized again with points to justify the other nights. That said, I'll most likely stay at other hotels I've enjoyed in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, pure and simple”
Reviews.Author: grayhosue
Reviews.Content: We stayed there free with Hyatt Gold Passport points. Amazing room, amazing bathroom, great sense of privilege and luxury. Very gracious staff at desk and door. Considerably beyond our budget had we been paying for the room, and the problem with that is that everything else is so expensive, in keeping with room price, so we did not even use a bottle of water from the refrigerator. We splurged, however, on the 42-euro breakfast buffet one day and it was delicious and actually seemed like a reasonable value. Abundant food, beautiful presented, graciously hosted, and very good. A lovely experience overall, as was the entire stay. Small caveats relating to housekeeping: Oddly, there were some small stains on the sofa and a few on the carpet; we received ice and bed turn-down one night but not the other; the free newspaper to which we were entitled and that we had specified was only delivered one morning; one of the wall-lamps had a burned-out bulb, and light was not great overall. TV was tiny, though flat screen. But given that we were paying nothing to stay in truly luxurious surroundings, it seems ungracious to note these small failings--had we been paying I would have been a bit disappointed by these collective glitches.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Peech
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect - between Place Vendome and Opera Garnier. The rooms are very spacious by Parisien standards, with a huge bed (bigger than king size?) and a large bathroom with two separate sinks in different areas. Free Wifi is great. Did not eat in the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff a little cold!”
Reviews.Author: gwhite216
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt is a great hotel in a great location. We stayed in room 308 which was great considering we used faster free nights. As a Hyatt Diamond member we received complimentary breakfast (which at 42 EUR was a welcome gift). We however were not recognized at check in, did not receive a welcome amenity, nor upgrade. The hotel is beautifully modern and the bathrooms are great. I will say the little bronze statues tend to get creepy after 5 days. The dining options are extremely expensive but at the same time it is a luxury hotel in Paris. There are several good dining options around the hotel. Do not ask the concierge unless you have no budget. We asked for a pizza place as we were beat from the day and she suggested a Mediterranean restaurant in which individual pizzas started at 30 EUR. We did eat in the bar one night and it was a nice atmosphere. Again, prices were steep. A cheeseburger, chicken club, 2 glasses of the least expensive wine, and a bottle of Evian was 111 EUR. Beers are around 14 EUR while mixed drinks are 25 EUR. The only real problem we encountered was at check out. The computers were down and I could not get a bill. BEWARE of the currency exchange at the hotel! They only gave us an exchange rate of .60 USD per 1 EUR. This was ridiculous considering the current exchange was .77 USD per 1 EUR. When we returned I took this up with Hyatt customer relations and the exchange was chalked up to a mistake and I received an apology and refund. I would stay there again do to location and facilities. I would take note on what we learned on this trip, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great location comes at a hefty price”
Reviews.Author: annettet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and found the front desk staff very efficient, we even borrowed a free DVD but had no time to watch it. The room was lovely with small terrace out onto the court yard which we left the doors open at night rather than use the air con as we found it stuffy even in february. Wonderful location very close to major attractions, the down side the cost for the mini bar was well over the top 12 Euros for a can of coke Â£11 is outrageous. Good facilities but on a long weekend we did not really get the time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: alexandert
Reviews.Content: Much better than your average Hyatt Hotel - this hotel for me was the perfect butique hotel. Excellent service, very cosy and comfortable public areas and exquisite rooms all contributed to an exdelent stay. The location was great as a base to discover Paris - you will not go wromg with this one - though it is not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1travelbug007
Reviews.Content: We didn't think it was possible, but we were in an extremely QUIET room and were able to get a good nights rest. In Paris, noise is often an issue with so many older hotels and older construction including plumbing issues. The hotel staff was helpful and gave us good recommendations for services and touring ideas. My husband does speak some french, but they were just as nice to me (who speaks - little french).

Reviews.Title: “Service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: HopingThisHelps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days during the Tour de France, and while we were very happy with the location, design, and room, we will think twice about coming back since we expected better service from the front desk as well as the concierge. None of the hotel staff we encountered were particularly hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: a_freq_traveller
Reviews.Content: a great hotel in almost all respects. Location is fantastic, entire hotel is done in a lovely but not overdone manner. Food in restaurants very good. Only minor complaint would be the gym, which is a converted guest suite. They could do better than that.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Chrystianne
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located at Place Vendome (near the Ritz Hotel), upscale area of Paris. The rooms are beautifully decorated and large. The bed is "heavenly"! Marble through-out bath area with separate shower, large tub and toilette area. Cozy robes and slippers provided along with ice and free bottled water at bed turn-down. Iron-men decor and knobs through-out room. Only a handful of rooms have a private balcony-ask for one of those. Staff speaks fluent English and are there to provide you an excellent stay. Concierge very helpful. Buffet breakfast, for the price, not so plentiful for 48 euros--includes hot beverage, freshly-squeezed juice, cereals, pastries, cold ham, choice of eggs. The area consists mostly of up-scale shops and one must walk a bit of a distance to find cafes and inexpensive dining. If you prefer luxury and not a true Parisian boutique hotel this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VacationersNJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 19 month old daughter recently made a trip to Amsterdam for a wedding. As a side trip we decided to go to Paris for 3 nights. Our entire trip was booked through Amex Platinum Travel Services. Upon our arrival to Paris we were greeted at the train station by a hotel driver who took us directly to the hotel. The car was also fitted with a child seat to accomodate my daughter. At check-in we were notified that since we booked through Amex they were going to upgrade us to the Junior Suite but they had to give our room away (we arrived on Bastille Day). After what seemed like a few minutes they eventually upgraded us from my original booking of a King Deluxe to the Executive Suite. We were eventually escorted to our room and was pleasantly surprised. There was plenty of room, 2 rooms to be exact (bedroom and living room), for our daughter to run around and explore. During our stay the hotel staff were very accomodating and extremely professional, but most of all....friendly! Our trip back to the train station was again provided by the hotel. As we exited the hotel our luggage was all ready in the car and the driver waiting for us. One last side comment, as the previous reviews have stated about the aroma/Park Hyatt Paris Vendome scent, you either like it or don't but eventually you will get used to it.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and not great concierge service”
Reviews.Author: ack
Reviews.Content: Overall the Park Hyatt is a nice hotel. The location is splendid - right in the place de la Vendome, steps away from the Louvre, and most anything in the downtown area. The hotel itself is nicely updated and very comfortable - actually quite luxurious. The problems are twofold - price and service. The price of a room at the hotel, including exchange rate (for even the smaller rooms) is over $700 a night. Now that is very expensive. For that price I think you can do better, even in paris The service at the hotel is not all that good. The concierge suggested an absolutely horrible restaurant the first night we were at the hotel. I mean, come on, how hard is it to find a nice restaurant in Paris!! Secondly, we had a hotel car take us to the train station on our last day in Paris and the concierge mistakenly had it meet us at 7PM vs. the 7AM that we wanted. Of course we found this out when we came down to check out!! Overall, would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it, but overall disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTravellerSJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt for 3 nights in July using Gold Passport points. I had scoured the other TripAdvisor reviews which were mainly very positive, so we had high expectations. Unfortunately, we got an extremely snooty check-in manager who refused to even look at the upgrade certificate I had much less honor it. She just kept insisting that the certificate had to be provided when making the reservation (which I did). It went downhill from there - room was tiny and worn, our curtains kept falling down. Breakfast was wonderful, but had been promised to be free of charge for being a Diamond member. Upon check out we got the same rude lady at the front desk and she charged us for half the breakfast. Luckily my boyfriend reviewed the bill carefully, so we went back and had the charges reversed. The restaurant and bar are both ridiculously expensive, more so than other hotels of that caliber. So disappointed as I really wanted to love this place and have had great experiences at Park Hyatts in Chicago and Carmel.

Reviews.Title: “Great as Expected”
Reviews.Author: gwinpin
Reviews.Content: Went for a surprise Paris trip for my wife's Birthday and had a great time, despite terrible weather (meaning we actually stayed inside more than usual). As usual, Hyatt tries to be the best in business and you can expect very attentive staff catering to any request you may have. Additionally, the e-concierge service is great, as long as you do your own research on which places and restaurants you want to go to, they'll book them for you, along with Spa, transportation, etc... The lounge is very nice in the evening, and drinks were excellent. However, given that it's Hyatt, and given that it's Paris, breakfast could be a bit better. We didn't care too much because we don't eat much in the morning, but I could see this being a problem for some people... Finally, the Spa is good, but nothing special. But overall a very good stay, although definitely not cheap...

Reviews.Title: “A happy return to our chic and comfortable Paris haven”
Reviews.Author: Honu_Ohana
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Park Hyatt Vendome. We managed to have enough points for one free night, which made the lowest-grade Park room barely affordable--we booked late this time due to schedule difficulties with the trip (a business trip for my spouse) and the rates were no bargain via Hyatt: 650 euros. As always, the concierge staff were extremely helpful before and during our stay. We used email in advance to secure restaurant reservations, although once again we were unable to get into Jules Verne. During the stay, they were helpful with directions. a museum pass for me (see trip report at http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g187147-i14-k1998211-Paris_report_summary_of_a_fast_paced_trip-Paris_Ile_de_France.html) and in tracking down our delayed car on the departure day. All the staff are very young and chic, but not haughty or unfriendly, even when I showed up lugging my Monoprix shopping bags. I tried to balance looking bedraggled in white sneakers after a day in the museums with looking better and carrying my gold Ferragamo bag to dinner, but actually they treated me well no matter how un-chic I appeared! The hotel still has its signature fragrance in the halls and in the room. Our room was quite nice--they upgraded us a bit so we would not have to move, I think (the free night was supposed to be in a deluxe room). This room was smallish but was right on the street with the great view up to Opera and down to Place Vendome. I will attach photos to this review in a bit, once I get them loaded onto my computer, so please check back. The room was excellent, well kept (only a few carpet scuffs and a couple of loose threasd on the bedskirt corner). Despite having been there previously, I still have not mastered the complex light switch functions. Another constant--a design feature, not a bug, I am sure--is that water drains unpredictably and repeatedly from the shower head after use, sometimes in the wee hours of the morning. They have added additional TV channels, more in English now. Room service breakfasts are expensive (35 euros) so I was thankful for t he free coffee for Gold Passport guests, also delivered by room service. This is the latest in spring we've stayed here, and for the first time it was warm and the courtyard was open for drinks. It has a very nice atmosphere and excellent wine by the glass selections to choose from. The little dish of olives, nuts, and crackers served with the drinks is perfect. There is wifi in the rooms. We did not bring a laptop (my husband had ues of one where he was working) so I used the complimentary laptop/web access in the small room next to reception. I still am not used to the French keyboard, so please excuse the typos in the restaurant reviews, which I wrote there! Pur' http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g187147-d719852-r16229960-Pur_Grill_Hyatt_Paris_Vendome-Paris_Ile_de_France.html; Les Ambassadeurs http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g187147-d699868-r16286684-Les_Ambassadeurs-Paris_Ile_de_France.html; and Joel Robuchon http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g187147-d718134-r16286355-L_Atelier_de_Joel_Robuchon-Paris_Ile_de_France.html

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not so great room”
Reviews.Author: gtahir
Reviews.Content: The location at Vendome is the best thing about this hotel. Everything about this hotel has Park Hyatt standard written all over it, loved the spacious and clean bathroom. Was not too crazy about the bedroom. The colors are so dark (dark blue, maroon), which did not complement the natural stone color of the lobby, the bathroom and the facade of the building. I also didn't find the staff to be that friendly, considering how expensive the hotel is, they should not be snobbish and throwing attitudes toward young children, but should be more courteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodmaster68
Reviews.Content: After staying in a horrendous hotel elsewhere in Paris, we moved mid-week to the Park Hyatt - what a great difference! This hotel is all about service and atmosphere: every time you enter you are greeted warmly; there are several areas for cocktails, including a modern fireplace; clean lines and bronze sculpture give a totally fresh, artistic feel to the place; and the attention to detail is amazing. It is certainly not cheap, but the service was top notch - which is critical to us when traveling. Room service took 20 minutes, they had free DVD movies to borrow, and the bathroom was quite large (a shower and separate bathtub, with a dressing area between the open closets). It was raining - and they handed us an umbrella. We needed a cab - it was ready and waiting. We had our 10 year old son with us as well, and they brought a comfy roll away for him. The king size bed was plush and soft, and the electric shades were a real modern touch. Paris is not a place to save money; my advice is to book a room at the Park Hyatt and live a little!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, both Hyatt Gold Passport members, each used points to book a night at the hotel. Our two nights there were wonderful, and the staff always incredibly friendly, unpretentious, and ever ready to be helpful. At no point during the stay were we made to feel like we were second class citizens for booking the free nights. The location is amazing. We were right next to the Place Vendome (and also a few steps from the Hotel Westminster where we'd spent the previous few nights) and the Opera. It is a great location for any tourist, and there's of course a taxi line for business people that need to be whisked off somewhere else. I think people that travel to Paris frequently will find contemporary designs for their rooms actually quite welcome, and that was how we felt about the room. The area around the bed is a little tight, but the bathrooms are amazing. The shower has a rain shower head and also there is a separate sink for shaving inside the shower area, and a place to sit if you like. The doors for the bathroom are clever, two perpendicular sliding doors that can be used to wall off the bathroom area. The food at the hotel is terrific - we were both surprised at the quality of the room service onion soup, for instance. Overall, the hotel experience is a huge step up from the 4 star hotel class of which there are many examples. If you feel comfortable parting with the requisite dosh I think there'd be few places in Paris where you'd do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled99
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with small rooms. The pictures on the website are deceiving. I booked a Deluxe room which cost EUR100 more. This room was so small that you could only walk around the bed. Who knows how small the non-Deluxe room is. The furnishings are modern and cheaply furnished. There is a big workspace in the room made of cheap laminated wood. which is already chipped. Poorly decorated rooms are oppressive. Hyatt offers an E-Concierge service which is great idea, but in this case the Concierge claimed "the system didnt generate a message to him". Two drinks in the lounge cost EUR47. Nuff said. I like luxurious hotels and generally stay in the best. I liked the Park Hyatt's in San Francisco and Sydney so thought this would be a welcome change. What a mistake. Next time I stay at the Meurice, Crillon or Ritz again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: aba1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. After looking into a number of hotels, including the classic palace hotels, we decided we wanted to stay somewhere with a little more modern chic. The staff was extremely helpful throughout our stay; from the moment we arrived through checkout, their service factored heavily into a most unforgettable stay. When we checked in, we found our suite faced the courtyard. Although the room was comfortably quiet, we had thought we reserved a room with a view of the street. When we asked if we could switch rooms, we were told that there were no street view rooms available. I was visibly disappointed but understood. After I returned to my room, about 30 minutes later we received a complimentary bottle of champagne and a bowl of fresh strawberries. We thought it a great effort on behalf of the staff to make up for the lack of street view room available to us. We had reservations one night at a restaurant that required us to reconfirm within 24 hours. When we didn't call the restaurant, they called our hotel as they were informed as to where we would be staying. The concierge took the liberty of reconfirming for us and slipped a confirmation note under our door. We appreciated the fact that they took care of that for us as we completely forgot we had to reconfirm. On another evening, we went to Le Bar in the hotel. The table side service and pouring was excellent and gave you that vintage cocktail bar impression. We also found the bartender to be a wonderful mixologist as he created drinks so delicious, we just had to order several rounds in order to try a few of their specialty cocktails. With regard to the hotel's dining options, unfortunately we did not eat at any of the restaurants. However, we ordered breakfast in the room several times. Basic American breakfast with your typical poached eggs, sausages and bacon. However, the bread basket we ordered additionally was fantastic. We felt that the in-house hotel bakers that made our mini baguettes, chocolate croissants, etc., could rival the best stand-alone boulangeries in Paris. One last note: I've read in other reviews about what has been said about the designer scent that permeates throughout the hotel corridors and lobby. Some guests tolerated it, while we, eventually, absolutely fell in love with it. When we first arrived, we found the scent to be like a little nudge that would not stop. After a day or two we got used to it and sought to buy it from the hotel in eau de toilette form to take home, but it was not for sale. However, all of the toiletries in our bathroom were of the same scent and we took those home instead. Now once in awhile, when my wife uses some of the hand lotion, the scent always reminds us of our honeymoon stay at the Park Hyatt Vendome. Pleasant memories indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, (for free) very very nice staff and 5 star Plus”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: This was a free stay with a prom Hyatt was running, stay twice at any Hyatt, and get a free night at any Hyatt.. Well there is no better place to get a free night then Paris. The room we had, was priced at over 1500EURO a night. Free night with an upgrade.. WOW.. Was it worth the sticker price, NO WAY, but really is any hotel. I'm sure one could get a room at the Park Hyatt at a lot less. We were able to check in early, and the staff was very helpful. The room was large with a wonderful bathroom.. The show was huge, and everything was top quality! The location was right down the street from the Opra. With metro stops right there.. If you are flying in, we took the bus, a slow long ride in traffic but dropped off right at the Opra, then a 5 min walk to the hotel. It was NOT the Air France bus, I forget the name, but it was run by the city bus system. I did not eat at the Hyatt, as the breakfast was over 40 euro a person. Bottles of water in the room were 10 euro.. So it is not cheap at all, but very nice..

Reviews.Title: “Low key luxury at the Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter87
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt in Paris is a peaceful hotel, with a fantastic location and is totally low key. It has done of the glitz and glamour of the traditional 'palais' in Paris, so if this is what you want, then this hotel is not for you. Having said that the modern design is the most luxurious around and the rooms are fantastic. The hotel is designed by the same person who did many of the Aman resorts (notably the Amanjena). The restaurant and breakfast is also absolutely fantastic and the spa is great too. The only thing the hotel sometimes lacks is the great attention to detail that hotels such as the PA and the G5 have. The service is however efficient and totally without pretence.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: WestchesterMom07
Reviews.Content: I just visited the Park Hyatt Vendome, Paris with my husband and two kids (14 year old boy and 11 year old girl). The hotel was excellent. We had a problem with our reservation when we arrived that was quickly resolved to everyone's satisfaction. The staff was efficient and professional. We chose the hotel based on the reviews in Trip Advisor, location, and the availability of adjoining rooms which allowed our kids to have their own room very close by. We kept the adjoining room door open and we felt like we had our own suite. Just a note, my husband and I had a deluxe room and the children a standard room. The only difference is the deluxe had a large walk-in closet/dressing room, otherwise the rooms were virtually the same. Our room was located on the first floor (which is actually the second floor by American standards) just above the front entrance which gave us large windows that opened up like French doors where we could poke our head out and see right into the Place Vendome. The location is excellent allowing us to walk to the Tuileries, the Louvre, and across the river to the Musee d'Orsay and the boat trips. The metro was easily accessible from the location, too. My only complaints are rather minor. (1) the roman-style shades didn't block out the light in the morning and let the morning sun stream right into your face on the bed. I propped a pillow against the shades at night to close up the space. (2) the housekeeping would move all of my toiletries around to clean up the bathroom, even repacked them into my toiletry bag. I learned to keep my toiletries off the counter and that stopped that. We didn't love the signature scent permeating throughout the hotel but it wasn't as noticeable in the room. When we opened our suitcases after the trip, everything in it still smelled of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: TheAviator2
Reviews.Content: Park Hyatt Paris is a delightful property to stay in. The rooms are very comfortable, the common areas are elegant, and the location is outstanding. Our biggest disappointment was that the spa area was not open due to the renovations. The completion date has slipped to the end of August and should be very nice when complete. Valet parking is complimentary, which is a really nice extra in a location like this. Room rates and F&B are both quite expensive, but if you are able to afford it, I highly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: minniemouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt in July for two nights and we had a great time. It was elegant, comfortable, clean, and the service was exceptional. I booked the reservation thru "Whatahotel.com" and we got a lot of perks. Our room was upgraded and we got breakfast each morning. The turndown included a whole box of house made chocolates on the first night. Also, they treated us to a very generous tapas plate one night with champagne and a cocktail. I have seen some other reviews that mention bad service. We got exceptional service. The breakfast buffet was excellent. We have been disappointed with our hotel choices in Paris in the past and this was a special trip so we decided to splurge this time and we were not disappointed. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated and comfortable. The pillows were down, the sheets were silky and the bed was great. The bathroom was very good too and the bath amenities were very nice. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: ilkkar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Hyatt Vendome with my fiancee on November. Overall, we were very pleased with the stay. The hotel has an excellent location near attractions if you are visiting in Paris as a tourist. We liked the design and decoration of our room, which also had a small balcony, that was nice. My fiancee had a superb massage treatment in the spa. We had a dinner in the hotel's restaurant, which was very nice and professionally served, although quite pricey. The hotel's bar and the room service was way overpriced, but worked well and had a good selection. The staff were young and friendly. The service was generally very good during our stay. We will definitely stay at Park Hyatt Vendome again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but snobby staff”
Reviews.Author: ZAK12003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Paris where we stayed four nights at the Park Hyatt. I chose this hotel after reading all the great reviews. The location is great. It is walking distance from all the major sites. The hotel lobby did not have a grand feel to it but it did feel warm. The room was smaller than I had hoped for after reading all the reviews of how small rooms are in Paris. I just thought the Hyatt would have been a little more generous with size. Our room overlooked the courtyard which I didnâ€™t really care for since I would rather be looking at Paris rather than other peopleâ€™s windows. But the most shocking thing we noticed was that our toilet had just been used and there was a cigarette in the toilet! There were even skid marks in the toilet. I called the reception to inform them of the bathroomâ€™s condition and got a very cold response. After explaining to them everything in DETAIL they told me, as if they were doing me a favor, they will send up housekeeping. The least they could do was transfer us to another room. The rest of the room and bathroom was clean. Another incident was after coming back from a late dinner to the hotel we decided to have a few drinks at the bar/lounge. The manager came to us and told us we can only have one drink since it was closing time. I told him that was fine. We ordered our drinks and the waiter gave our check immediately saying that he was going off duty. 20 minutes later a group of six international business men walked into the bar and sat down right next to us. The manager and our waiter went straight over to them and gave them the cocktail menu and did not mention a word of how they were closing. He took everybodyâ€™s order and did not give them their check right away. It seemed like they would be there all night. We were quite disgusted so we left. Overall it is a good hotel with a horrible staff.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, all around great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxtrvl
Reviews.Content: This was an all around great hotel. It is a 5star hotel with a 5star price though in comparison to other 5stars it's one of the more reasonable ones especially if you have an American Express platinum card as you get a discounted price and added amenities booking through them. The service is top notch from the minute you arrive to the minute you leave. The hotel is very clean and has it's own signature scent though it's barely noticable, nice without being overpowering at all. the only thing overpowering may have been their signature statue which was everywhere you turned! This hotel is very modern with just a touch of traditionalism. It has an art deco style to it I'd say. The rooms are a nice size and love the double sinks in the oversized bathrooms. We stayed in the park deluxe which is just the 2nd room category up but an amazing room. You are within an easy walk of The Louvre, The Opera and many other attractions. I honestly can't say I had any negative experiences during my stay and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Bobrich
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we left, the Park Hyatt was fabulous. Our room was on the top floor .. 4 windows looking out at a quiet courtyard. We had a king size bed, excellent lighting, a dressing room with 2 separate areas..each had a separate vanity and sink. The shower had a combo ceiling shower head and handheld. There was also a separate tub. The dressing room floor was heated. The staff was very polite and helpful. The breakfast in the orchid room was elegant. The smoked salmon was thinly sliced and arranged in a star shape. The rolls, cheese, yogurt, juice, fruits, and coffee were plentiful. I especially liked the refills on coffee in large cups. The only thing that could have been improved was the evening turndown service. We had to ask for it for the first 4 nights. After that, it was done without additional requests. I also missed the chocolate on the pillow. The location was excellent...easy walk to several metro stations. Next time, I'm in Paris, I would certainly hope to stay at the Hyatt Vendome. The hotel and staff were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Franto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Hyatt in Place Vendome in Dec 05. It was after Christmas. The location is excellent because we like to eat late dinners and we found quite a few nice restaurants open within a block of the Park Hyatt. We dispensed with having breakfast at the hotel because in Paris we like the adventure of actually strolling the streets in search of good coffee and the nice breakfast pastries Paris is known for. Service was very good. The room was cleaned everytime we left it. We customarily used the bar downstairs for a nightcap. Overall, great location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chrisedge
Reviews.Content: We had our travel agent book this directly since it wasn't "available" through them, yet we could book it ourselves. We stayed in Oct 2006 during fashion week, and it couldn't have been nicer. Great service, super room, and breakfast was included in our price. While it was pretty expensive, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “I want to be there now...”
Reviews.Author: alwong2000
Reviews.Content: Spectacular location with all of the high-end shopping you could want only steps away. Extremely friendly staff. Room was booked using Gold Passport points, so I was also expecting a small room, but was quite pleased. Free room service beverage for Gold Passport members (hot chocolate was very good). Bang & Olufsen television. Very convenient to Louvre, other museums, and Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buccsmf1
Reviews.Content: Once of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Walking distance from the louvre, great shopping nearby (tiffany's right across the street, definetly a plus for the women) and an overall great hotel. Keep in mind that this is a very modern hotel, so if you're looking for a classic style for your paris vacation look elsewere. The rooms are definetly amazing though. We had a corner suite with a lovely balcony overlooking the street and down to the plaza vendome. One of the best in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive & Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: omegaet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the Park Hyatt Paris-Vendome (used Gold Passport points and expected to receive only a broom closet for a room in this highly rated hotel). At check-in, we were greeted by a cheerful smile and an unexpected upgrade to a Park Deluxe Queen (#432) overlooking the Rue de la Paixâ€¦.no traffic noise could be heard, thanks to the double insulated glass in the windows and the doors opening on to a small balcony with awning (great place to sip room service morning coffee [free to Gold Passport Members] and gaze at the autumn colors in the Tulleries. One of the first things we noticed was the pleasant fragrance in the common areas, the hallways to our room and inside of our room. We inquired and learned that noted fashion perfumer, Blaise Mautin, had been hired been to create a signature line of bath sundries with a unique fragrance for the Park Hyatt (they now pump the fragrance into the ventilation system). Nice touch! The room was decorated in earth tones, gold and warm wood. The lighting was elegant and subdued and the wall decorations, light sconces and door handles consisted of custom bronze work (also present in common area sculptures and chandeliers). The bathroom was entered by unique sliding walls. While granite and marble were liberally used in the construction of the tub, vanities and unique rain shower (the floor surfaces were heated to eliminate any morning foot shock). We received exceptional restaurant recommendations (Barlotti, Maceo and Williâ€™s Wine Bar) from Gilles, the concierge, and were treated like royalty by Alice at the front desk and Jean-Charles for our evening cocktails by the lobby fireplace. Yes, weâ€™ll return to the Park Hyatt Paris-Vendome and pay the going room rateâ€¦.itâ€™s worth the Euros to enjoy life!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: whimsical1
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with my husband on a business trip to Paris. (Who wouldn't?) He selected this hotel. It was in a fabulous location. While he was working, I was able to walk from the hotel to the Louvre, Opera, Printemps Dept. Store, Galleries of Lafayette Store, Rue de Honore, Rue de Rivoli. It was so magical. The hotel is in a very upscale neighborhood. My husband was a little worried with Cartier right next door. The hotel is very modern and our room was overlooking the Rue de la Paix which I loved. It was noisey with the windows open but it is Paris. We loved the sounds of the city. If you want more quiet, you can ask for an inside room.
