We asked for one facing the street and I loved that we could open the windows. Our room was quite large even by American standards. They upgraded us from a queen room to a king. The closet space was the best ever in Europe and maybe even in the U.S. We had plenty of room to hang all of our clothes and drawers as well. The bathroom was especially nice with heated marble floors, bathtub and a separate walk in marble shower. The service from the staff of the hotel was truly exceptional. We were very impressed with how nice and accommodating everyone was. I felt very safe walking by myself in this lovely area. I canâ€™t say enough for the great location just steps away from the Place Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReneB
Reviews.Content: We also just stayed at the PArk Hyatt. We had a wonderful room overlooking the courtyard very quiet. The room was clean with many english statuions on the television. The Hyatt reccomended a wonderful cafe for dinner (Cafe Rue Le Paix)The only negative was that the hotel was very expensive to eat and have a beer.

Reviews.Title: “way to go guys”
Reviews.Author: Alexandrabuenosaires
Reviews.Content: Eventhough the hotel was full, it still felt like a serene oasis in bustling Paris. I liked the warm welcome and the PRO-Service from the front desk staff and the concierge. Way to go guys!

Reviews.Title: “Parisian perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Paris2TX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days with my two children. Had two adjoining rooms. Spacious and impeccable. Loved the bathrooms and dressing rooms. Beds were very comfortable. Service was perfect-- very discreet. Loved the fact that each room had a door bell--- thus we didnt hear any banging on doors up and down the halls. Not particularly child friendly, but that's a cultural issue. Room service breakfasts were divine. Note--- free room service coffee is provided to Hyatt Passport members--- it's in fine print on the bottom of the breakfast door- hanger/menu. That is a huge savings as the food is extremely expensive. The location is great- quick walk to Louvre and the Tuileries etc. Only complaint-- while we were there a guest on a higher floor caused a fire in his room. Firetrucks were there for hours. The smell was noticeable in our room-- 4 floors beneath the fire. I was surprised that the managment did not slip a note under all of the guests' doors- explaining what had happened. We asked at the front desk. Apart from that--- it was perfect. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few noticeable hiccups...”
Reviews.Author: JMac123
Reviews.Content: Let me start off my first saying that this review may be a bit slanted as I came to this hotel after staying at the George V for 4 nights. In my opinion, there is absolutely no comparison between the 2 hotels. The George V was excellent in every way, but that's another story. I'll stick with the Park Hyatt for my review here: Arrival: We arrived at the hotel and arrived to the ambivalent doormen. I believe they were fairly full due to a conference, but this is no excuse for having our bags quickly taken away without even a smile and quickly asking for our names. We were then just pointed quickly to the check-in desk and told they would take care of us. Check-in: Again, quite indifferent. Just a "Here's your room, let me show it to you." When we got to the room, another "here you go" and nothing like "Is this satisfactory?" or any other issues. Again, not a huge deal, but for them to claim to be in the same category as other top of the line hotels in Paris- unacceptable. The Rooms: Nice and large and well-equipped. However, quite a bit too modern for my tastes and the air conditioner would not keep the room very cool. A little too dark also. Not a big problem with the overall room, as again it was quite nice, but not exactly my cup of tea. Room service: Good food. Timeliness was an issue though and they never really seemed to have their act together with regards to how many people were eating. Twice they set the table for 1 as my wife ordered a salad only so they thought that was my side dish even after I told them that it was for people. Had to have them return both times with addtional place settings. Business Center: Terrible. The good news is it's free but is is basically a cramped area behind the check-in desk with 2 PC's smashed close together. If you're working with someone else in the same room at once it gets very crowded. Overall I wasn't extremely disappointed, but for the hotel category they claim to be, they have some kinks to work out particularly in the service area. Would I return? Probably not, the main reason I would stay there is for the Hyatt Gold Passport points.

Reviews.Title: “The Finest Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: jackfurlongesq_123
Reviews.Content: I purposely omitted a review of the Hyatt Place Vendome, for fear that gushing reviews only attract more people. Better for me if folks look elsewhere, leaving me the opportunity to upgrade in their absence. But another reviewer's negative rant prompted this rebuttal. Spent a weekend there last summer before touring Provence, Venice, Lugano, and Geneva. Perhaps sorry to say, our first weekend in Paris was the highlight of the trip. The hotel is immaculate. Staff are peerless in their courtesy and accommodation (and being an American in Paris ain't the easiest these days). Junior suite was capacious, sleek, modern, well-arranged, and hundreds of Euro cheaper than George V or the other first-tier hotels. Steam room was free (a vanishing perk these days), restaurant and lounge were relaxing, and the location is easy walking distance to the Louvre, Seine, and Left Bank. We arrived at 9AM from an overnight flight and they booked us into our room immediately. We also got a late checkout, help with logistics, free business center access, and 48 of the most relaxing hours I have spent. Problems? Ask for Camille Deveaux or Christof at the front desk: I'm sure they'll take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience yet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we have stsyed in 5 star hotels all over the world... this was the nicest, most lavish hotel experience we have had... any where ... In Paris better than Ritz, le Bristol, Lancaster. Geo.V

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to London and Paris and stayed at the Park Hyatt while in Paris. I had stayed at the Four Seasons Canary Wharf in London on business and it was absolutely brilliant. I had a few days off and had heard that the Park Hyatts were very nice so I decided to treat myself to a trip to Paris. The Park Hyatt Paris was just terrrible. The front desk staff was rude and the bell staff was useless. The rooms seemed very nice at first but upon closer inspection were not very clean. I am a neat freak so my expectations might be higher than most but come on there is no excuse for having hairs in the bath tub and stains on the carpets. The bed was pretty uncomfortable and the room was very noisy. I tried the health club and ended up leaving after one of the staff (kind of cute but with bad breath and no manners) tried to get me to go out with him and offered to show me the real Paris. Please, I don't need some loser like that in my life. The manager (I think his name was Philip or something like that) was no help at all and gave me a "this happens" attitude. I contacted Hyatt directly and am waiting to hear back about all this. Anyway , avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Visit - 1-7-06 to 1-9-06”
Reviews.Author: kyverdicts
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights arriving Saturday morning and departing Monday. The concierge was exceptionally efficient, making dinner arrangements in advance where I selected one night and then finding a nice choice for the second night. He also (Mr. Arnanda) advised of specific speciality stores in the area that I was interested and easily described them and placed them on a map. No qualms about the room -- the bathroom is excellent and the shower is especially nice. (Room 323). Avoid rooms ending in 23 as they are across from the maid station. Brunch at Les Orchides is not memorable. It was included with our package so I'm glad I didn't pay 66E for it. Not worth it. The bar was outstanding. The hotel is well-located to shopping, dining and the key musuems. {We visited Musee D'Orsay.] Problems? We didn't have any. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel for my job about 15 days out of each month and am used to wonderful hotels and great service. I am pretty demanding but am lucky enough to stay at only the best hotels. I decided to treat myself to a weekend holiday in Paris and decided to stay at this hotel since I had recently stayed at the Park Hyatt in Tokyo and loved it. What a difference between these two Park Hyatts. The Park Hyatt in Paris is just awful. If you want bad service and discrimination then this is the place for you. If not, stay elsewhere. I certainly will the next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rwingate
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at the Park Hyatt Paris. I had booked a standard room but upon check in the front desk informed me that they had several other categories of rooms available. I was shown a couple of rooms and decided to upgrade to a full suite. The standard room was small but had a nice bathroom. The suite I checked in to was priced at 1800E normally but they offered me the room at 980E. Overall the room was layed out nicely with several french doors opening on to a small terrace- very nice views! The room had a fireplace that the staff lite every morning and it automatically shut itself off at 200a. This added a lot to the overall feel of the suite. I was surprised at the hard wood floors throughout the suite. They definitely were showing their age with cracks and wear. The carpets (on part of the floor) were clean and fine. The bath was outstanding and incredibly large with 2 separate areas including a large shower and tub. The suite number was #540. I would recommend it for the location alone. The terrace was amazing. I would not pay the regular rate though of 1800E. I think that is way overpriced. I used the gym every day. It was small but nice. The steam room and mens changing area was imaculate and I cannot recommend it enough- Very Nice. The staff was professional and throughout my stay seemed very friendly. I had no problems with anyone. The bellmen were great too! I read in a couple reviews on this site that said all they did was smoke and act apathetic. I did not experience this attitude or treatment. In all cases they were nice and actually went out of thier way to help me with directions etc. I am a big fan of Park Hyatts. This property was great! Nice architecture too.

Reviews.Title: “A candid opinion: Six Stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I do not squander my time writing reviews about hotels. However, the review below has prompted me to give my candid opinion. The Park Hyatt is a splendid hotel: Great location, very friendly and "true" service -day and night-, good food, warm design and finally the right value for money (Paris terms 500+ Euros). You do not expect from and international five star hotel to be clean: It is a given. It is hard to believe that doormen are busy smoking cigarettes in the afternoon. After all, they live from the tips. I stayed at the hotel at least half a dozen times and never had I to wait longer than a couple of seconds before being checked in. They deliver faxes promptly. Good internet connectivity. Businessmen and women did not vote the Park Hyatt to be the best hotel in Paris because its staff seems consistently bothered by any request. I do agree with one thing. There is no alarm clock. To be honest, who needs one in the age of gadgets like PDA, BB and mobile phones. The Park Hyatt is my hotel of choice. For leisure and business. And as you are reading this review, you can be sure it is a candid one. I do recommend the Park Hyatt Paris as one of Europe's great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Far below my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ToohothereinTexas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a few nights and had chosen it based upon its location and the positive reviews I had read here. In retrospect, I should have paid closer attention to the more negative reviews and to my instincts. I found the service at this hotel to be lacking right from the start. The two doormen were busy smoking cigarettes and seemed rather bothered by my arrival. The lone front desk agent was arguing with the guest in front of me when I arrived in the afternoon and tried to check in. After several minutes a second agent came out and rather than helping me she joined in the argument that was still going on. After several more minutes the first agent checked me in and told me that they remembered me from my prior stay and were very happy to have me back. Of note, I had never been to this hotel before. In any event, there were no rooms ready which was odd given that it was the mid-afternoon and the hotel was not fully booked. I waited an hour until a room was ready and it then took forever for my single bag to be delivered. The room itself was nice but not exactly set up for someone like myself who was travelling for business and it was not as clean as I would have liked. I also found it odd that there was no alarm clock in the room. I did not spend too much time at the hotel since I had to go to meetings but I did find that the staff, with the exception of room service which I used for breakfast in the morning, seemed consistently bothered by any requests I made. In any event, I hope that this review is of some help and I would certainly not recommend this hotel given my negative experience and given that there are so many other wonderful hotels in Paris
